original: @260b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @260b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: krishna ya m'a ri tantra sya panytsi ka ratna aa ba li n'a ma /
analyzed: krishna ya m'a ri tantra sya panytsi ka ratna aa ba li n'a ma /
translated: Kṛṣṇayamāri tantra's pañcikā ratnāvalī nāma.

original: bod skad du ;
analyzed: bod skad du ;
translated: In Tibetan:

original: gshin rje gshed nag po'i rgyud kyi dka' 'grel rin po che'i phreng ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: gshin rje gshed nag po'i rgyud kyi dka' 'grel rin po che'i phreng ba zhes bya ba /
translated: The commentary on the Kṛṣṇayamāri tantra called The Precious Garland.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Vajrasattva.

original: bcom ldan 'das gshin rje gshed nag po la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gshin rje gshed nag po la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Black Yamāri.

original: dpal ldan gshin rje gshed po yon tan ma lus rab tu 'khrungs //
analyzed: dpal ldan gshin rje gshed po yon tan ma lus rab tu 'khrungs //
translated: The glorious Yamāri, from whom all good qualities arise,

original: 'od zer sngon po 'jig pa'i dus kyi char sprin gzhon nu ste //
analyzed: 'od zer sngon po 'jig pa'i dus kyi char sprin gzhon nu ste //
translated: With blue light like a youthful rain cloud at the time of destruction,

original: zhal gsum pa la rdo rje ral gri 'dzin cing gri gug bcas //
analyzed: zhal gsum pa la rdo rje ral gri 'dzin cing gri gug bcas //
translated: With three faces holding a vajra and sword, and a flaying knife,

original: 'khor lo chu skyes thod pa bsnams pa mgo bos phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'khor lo chu skyes thod pa bsnams pa mgo bos phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Holding a wheel, lotus, and skull-cup, I bow my head.

original: 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Thus have I heard and so forth,

original: gsung rab rnams kyi ni kun gyi yang dag dang po yin la /
analyzed: gsung rab rnams kyi ni kun gyi yang dag dang po yin la /
translated: Is the true beginning of all the scriptures,

original: sdud pa po ni rjes su ston pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: sdud pa po ni rjes su ston pa'i tshig go //
translated: And the compiler is the word of the teacher.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i gnas skabs su gsungs pa las /🔽dngos su ni byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i gnas skabs su gsungs pa las / dngos su ni byas pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the Lord spoke at the time of his parinirvana:🔽“You should not take my teachings to be your own composition,🔽but as the words of the teacher himself,

original: ji ltar yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir dang / khyed rnams ni ston pa po'i dbang med pa las te nga'i chos rnams ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pas bsdus shig pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir dang / khyed rnams ni ston pa po'i dbang med pa las te nga'i chos rnams ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes pas bsdus shig pas so //
translated: and you should collect my teachings, saying ‘Thus have I heard.’

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni gang ji srid du rgyud thams cad las gsungs pa de lta bu nyid de bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ba ni gang ji srid du rgyud thams cad las gsungs pa de lta bu nyid de bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: “Thus” means that it is just as it was taught, not otherwise.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du thos pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du thos pa ste /
translated: “I” means that it was heard by myself, directly.🔽“I” means that it was heard by myself, directly.

original: ston pa bcom ldan 'das nyid la bdag gis thos kyi gcig nas gcig tu brgyud nas 'ongs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ston pa bcom ldan 'das nyid la bdag gis thos kyi gcig nas gcig tu brgyud nas 'ongs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: I heard it from the teacher, the Lord himself, and it was not transmitted from one to another.

original: gang gi tshe thos shing gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe thos shing gsungs she na /
translated: When was it heard and spoken?

original: sa ma ya ni dus so //
analyzed: sa ma ya ni dus so //
translated: Samaya is time.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das thub pa chen po'i byang chub la bar du gcod pa'i bdud nye bar lhags par gyur pa de'i tshe @261a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das thub pa chen po'i byang chub la bar du gcod pa'i bdud nye bar lhags par gyur pa de'i tshe @261a * //
translated: When the Blessed One, the Great Sage, was on the verge of enlightenment, Mara, the Evil One, came to obstruct him.

original: zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de skad du de nyid kyi le'u bco brgyad pa'i gtam rgyud brjod pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du de nyid kyi le'u bco brgyad pa'i gtam rgyud brjod pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is stated in the eighteenth chapter of the same text, in the story of the Buddha's life.

original: de yang ci dang ci zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci dang ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rgyud ma lus pa'i tshig thos zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: rgyud ma lus pa'i tshig thos zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: It is said, having heard the words of the entire tantra.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bcom pa dang ldan pas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bcom pa dang ldan pas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ste /
translated: Regarding Blessed One, etc., the Blessed One is so called because he possesses destruction.

original: bdud rnams bzhi po 'joms pas na //
analyzed: bdud rnams bzhi po 'joms pas na //
translated: Because he destroys the four Maras,

original: 'joms pa bcom ldan 'das su brjod //
analyzed: 'joms pa bcom ldan 'das su brjod //
translated: he is called the Blessed One, the Destroyer.

original: shes rab kyis ni nyon mongs 'joms //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni nyon mongs 'joms //
translated: By wisdom, he destroys the afflictions,

original: de phyir shes rab bcom ldan brjod //
analyzed: de phyir shes rab bcom ldan brjod //
translated: therefore wisdom is called the Blessed One.

original: ces pa'i tshig las snang ba med pa gsal ba bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes ni bcom pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa'i tshig las snang ba med pa gsal ba bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes ni bcom pa ste /
translated: From these words, the non-apparent, clear, great bliss nature wisdom is the destruction.

original: de dang ldan pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Possessing that is the Dharma Body.

original: de dang der yongs su rdzogs pa ni lha'i 'khor lo la dbang ba ste /
analyzed: de dang der yongs su rdzogs pa ni lha'i 'khor lo la dbang ba ste /
translated: The complete perfection of that and that is the mastery of the wheel of deities.

original: gang gis de ni rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs su rdzogs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis de ni rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs su rdzogs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: By that, he is perfected in the form of Vajrasattva.

original: bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'brel te /
analyzed: bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'brel te /
translated: The word “abides” is connected to the other.🔽Where does he abide?

original: gang du bzhugs she na gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang du bzhugs she na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “the tathāgatas” and so forth.

original: thams cad kyi sgra ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa so sor mngon par sbyor ba bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgra ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa so sor mngon par sbyor ba bya ste /
translated: The word “all” is to be applied individually to Akṣhobhya and so forth and the tathāgatas and so forth.

original: sna tshogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du sna tshogs pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du sna tshogs pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge'i rang bzhin no //
translated: In the various maṇḍalas, the various seed syllables are the nature.

original: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa ste dkyil 'khor ba'i lha'i skyes bu'o ;
analyzed: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa ste dkyil 'khor ba'i lha'i skyes bu'o ;
translated: Vajra means indivisible, the deities of the maṇḍala.

original: / btsun mo ni dkyil 'khor ma rnams te lha mo rnams so //
analyzed: / btsun mo ni dkyil 'khor ma rnams te lha mo rnams so //
translated: Queen means the maṇḍala ladies, the goddesses.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang rdo rje dang btsun mo dang zhes pa ste phan tshun bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang rdo rje dang btsun mo dang zhes pa ste phan tshun bsdu ba'o //
translated: The tathāgatas, vajras, and queens are mutually inclusive.

original: de'i rjes la bha ga'i sgras lhan cig de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra ni sngon du song ba'i tshig ste bskur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la bha ga'i sgras lhan cig de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra ni sngon du song ba'i tshig ste bskur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: After that, the word bhaga is together with the word tathagata, which is a prior word, for the sake of the object of the consecration.🔽Or, the word vajra and the word bhaga are together with the word tathagata, separately.🔽After that, the word sarva is together with the word bhaga, which is a prior word, for the sake of the object of the consecration.🔽Or, the word vajra and the word bhaga are together with the word tathagata, separately.🔽After that, the word sarva is together with the word bhaga, which is a prior word, for the sake of the object of the consecration.🔽Or, the word vajra and the word bhaga are together with the word tathagata, separately.🔽After that, the word sarva is together with the word bhaga, which is a prior word, for the sake of the object of the consecration.

original: yang na rdo rje dang btsun mo zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra dang lhan cig ste tha dad du'o //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje dang btsun mo zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra dang lhan cig ste tha dad du'o //
translated: Or, the word vajra and the word bhaga are together with the word tathagata, separately.

original: phyi nas thams cad kyi sgras lhan cig tu khyad par du bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nas thams cad kyi sgras lhan cig tu khyad par du bsdus pa'o //
translated: After that, the word sarva is together with the word bhaga, which is a prior word, for the sake of the object of the consecration.🔽Or, the word vajra and the word bhaga are together with the word tathagata, separately.

original: de'i rjes la bha ga'i sgras lhan cig pa ste de'i skyes bu'i drug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la bha ga'i sgras lhan cig pa ste de'i skyes bu'i drug pa'o //
translated: After that, the word sarva is together with the word bhaga, which is a prior word, for the sake of the object of the consecration.🔽Or, the word vajra and the word bhaga are together with the word tathagata, separately.

original: de la bha ga rnams la zhes pa ni skye gnas kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bha ga rnams la zhes pa ni skye gnas kyi phyir ro //
translated: After that, the word sarva is together with the word bhaga, which is a prior word, for the sake of the object of the consecration.🔽Or, the word vajra and the word bhaga are together with the word tathagata, separately.🔽After that, the word sarva is together with the word bhaga, which is a prior word, for the sake of the object of the consecration.🔽Or, the word vajra and the word bhaga are together with the word tathagata, separately.🔽After that, the word sarva is together with the word bhaga, which is a prior word, for the sake of the object of the consecration.

original: de dang der lha'i 'khor lo rdzogs pa la ltos pas na de dang de rnams rdo rje 'chang dang 'khyud pa'i padma'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de dang der lha'i 'khor lo rdzogs pa la ltos pas na de dang de rnams rdo rje 'chang dang 'khyud pa'i padma'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: Or, the word vajra and the word bhaga are together with the word tathagata, separately.

original: bzhugs zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang sbyor ba las byas pa'i tshogs kyis rol nas gang du dngos su ma grub pa de'i tshe bha ga rnams la zhes pa ni skyed par byed pa'i gnas kyi phyir te /
analyzed: bzhugs zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang sbyor ba las byas pa'i tshogs kyis rol nas gang du dngos su ma grub pa de'i tshe bha ga rnams la zhes pa ni skyed par byed pa'i gnas kyi phyir te /
translated: “Abiding” means that, having enjoyed the assembly created by the vajra and lotus, when they are not actually present, “in the bhagas” means in the places of generation.

original: sa bon de dang de rnams so //
analyzed: sa bon de dang de rnams so //
translated: Those and those seeds.

original: bzhugs @261b zhes pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bzhugs @261b zhes pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: “Abiding” means remaining.

original: gang du rang dang 'dra ba'i padmar gnas pa'i rdo rjes rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed nas lha'i 'khor lo nye bar bstan pa gsungs pa ni gti mug rdo rje gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang du rang dang 'dra ba'i padmar gnas pa'i rdo rjes rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed nas lha'i 'khor lo nye bar bstan pa gsungs pa ni gti mug rdo rje gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having generated Vajrasattva with the vajra abiding in the lotus of his own kind, he teaches the assembly of deities, beginning with “Delusion Vajra-Yāma.”

original: gti mug gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams kyis te lhan cig ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: gti mug gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams kyis te lhan cig ces pa'i don to //
translated: The seeds of Delusion-Yāma and so on are together, meaning simultaneously.

original: 'bras bu las gzhan ma yin par nye bar bstan pa'i don du gti mug gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i rgyud sa bon rnams la 'bras bu'i ming gis bstan to //
analyzed: 'bras bu las gzhan ma yin par nye bar bstan pa'i don du gti mug gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i rgyud sa bon rnams la 'bras bu'i ming gis bstan to //
translated: In order to teach that the result is not different from the cause, the seeds of the tantras of Delusion-Yāma and so on are taught by the name of the result.

original: de la mi phyed pa'i gti mug ni gti mug rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de la mi phyed pa'i gti mug ni gti mug rdo rje ste /
translated: The adamantine delusion is the delusion that is not divided.

original: de nyid che ba dang don med pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽gshin rje dang 'dra ba'i gshin rje ste /
analyzed: de nyid che ba dang don med pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro // gshin rje dang 'dra ba'i gshin rje ste /
translated: It is so called because it is the cause of greatness and of futility.

original: de'i dgra ni de dag rlag par byed pa can no //
analyzed: de'i dgra ni de dag rlag par byed pa can no //
translated: Yama is the Lord of Death, and his enemy is the one who destroys him.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni rnam par dpyad pas mi bzod pas na rang dang gzhan gyi 'gro ba'i rang bzhin skad cig so sor brdzun par bltas pa la gti mug yang dag par zad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni rnam par dpyad pas mi bzod pas na rang dang gzhan gyi 'gro ba'i rang bzhin skad cig so sor brdzun par bltas pa la gti mug yang dag par zad par byed pa'o //
translated: Since the apprehended object and apprehending subject are not able to withstand analysis, the destruction of delusion is the view that the nature of one's own and others' continua is false in every moment.

original: dang gi yi ge ni phan tshun du ltos nas bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: dang gi yi ge ni phan tshun du ltos nas bsdu ba'o //
translated: The word and is used to include the other three lines.

original: de bzhin du phra ma rdo rje gshin rje gshed la sogs pa tshig bzhi po 'di yang ste mi phyed pa la sogs pa thams cad du rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phra ma rdo rje gshin rje gshed la sogs pa tshig bzhi po 'di yang ste mi phyed pa la sogs pa thams cad du rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the four lines beginning with the adamantine slander are to be understood in the same way as the above, with not divided and so on.

original: de la bdag med pa la bdag tu 'dzin pa ni gti mug go //
analyzed: de la bdag med pa la bdag tu 'dzin pa ni gti mug go //
translated: Therein, delusion is the grasping at a self in the absence of a self.

original: gzhan dang rab tu 'byed pa'i tshig ni phra ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang rab tu 'byed pa'i tshig ni phra ma'o //
translated: Slander is the divisive word.

original: tshogs thams cad la zhen pa ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs thams cad la zhen pa ni chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment to all collections is passion.

original: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzod pa ni phrag dog go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzod pa ni phrag dog go //
translated: Jealousy is the inability to bear another's excellence.

original: tho ba gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tho ba gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The hammer Yamântaka, etc.

original: tho ba dang 'dra ba ste 'khor ba ma stongs kyi bar du sems can ma lus par son pa'i 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i brtan pa chen po tho bas 'joms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tho ba dang 'dra ba ste 'khor ba ma stongs kyi bar du sems can ma lus par son pa'i 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i brtan pa chen po tho bas 'joms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is like a hammer, because he destroys the great mountain of the false view of individuality which reaches to all sentient beings until the end of the world, with the hammer of wisdom.

original: gshin rje gshed ni gshin rje'i bdag nyid kyi dgra zhes bya ba 'jig tshogs su lta ba de nyid 'joms pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir tho ba gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed ni gshin rje'i bdag nyid kyi dgra zhes bya ba 'jig tshogs su lta ba de nyid 'joms pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir tho ba gshin rje gshed do //
translated: Yamântaka is the enemy of the nature of Yama, because he is the cause of the destruction of the false view of individuality.

original: de bzhin du phyi nas kyi cho ga gsum po dag la yang de nyid du las 'dzin par bsdu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi nas kyi cho ga gsum po dag la yang de nyid du las 'dzin par bsdu'o //
translated: Thus, the three external rites are included in the holding of the karma.

original: dbyig pa gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba ni dbyig pa dang 'dra bas te 'khor ba ma stongs kyi bar du sems can ma lus pa la gnas pa'i mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba'i skyon 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyig pa gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba ni dbyig pa dang 'dra bas te 'khor ba ma stongs kyi bar du sems can ma lus pa la gnas pa'i mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba'i skyon 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mace Yamari is like a mace, because it destroys the fault of the view of grasping extremes that abides in all sentient beings until samsara is emptied.

original: gshin rje gshed ni gshin rje'i bdag nyid can gyi dgra ste lta ba de nyid 'joms pa'i rgyur gyur pas na @262a * //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed ni gshin rje'i bdag nyid can gyi dgra ste lta ba de nyid 'joms pa'i rgyur gyur pas na @262a * //
translated: The Yamari of Death is an enemy with the nature of Yama, because it becomes the cause of destroying that view.

original: dbyig pa gshin rje gshed do //🔽padma gshin rje gshed dang zhes pa ni padma dang 'dra bas padma ste /
analyzed: dbyig pa gshin rje gshed do // padma gshin rje gshed dang zhes pa ni padma dang 'dra bas padma ste /
translated: Therefore, it is the mace Yamari.

original: log par lta ba'i 'dam gyis ma gos pa'i phyir dang log par lta ba'i gshin rje'i bdag nyid can gyi dgra'i phyir padma gshin rje gshed do //🔽ral gri gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba la ral gri dang 'dra bas ral gri ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i 'dam gyis ma gos pa'i phyir dang log par lta ba'i gshin rje'i bdag nyid can gyi dgra'i phyir padma gshin rje gshed do // ral gri gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba la ral gri dang 'dra bas ral gri ste /
translated: The lotus Yamari is like a lotus, because it is not soiled by the mud of wrong views and because it is the enemy of the nature of Yama of wrong views.🔽Therefore, it is the lotus Yamari.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i dgra gcod pas so //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i dgra gcod pas so //
translated: The sword Yamari is like a sword, because it severs the enemy of grasping views as supreme.

original: gshin rje gshed ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa de nyid gshin rje'i bdag nyid can te de'i dgra'i phyir ral gri gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa de nyid gshin rje'i bdag nyid can te de'i dgra'i phyir ral gri gshin rje gshed do //
translated: Yama is the very same as the one who holds the view of the supremacy of wrong views, and since he is the enemy of that, he is the Yama sword.

original: rdo rje rtsa rtsi ka zhes bya ba ni rdo rje rtsa tsi kas te gsum pa'i don la dang po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rtsa rtsi ka zhes bya ba ni rdo rje rtsa tsi kas te gsum pa'i don la dang po'o //
translated: The vajra-Tārā is the vajra-Tārā, the first of the three meanings.

original: de bzhin phyi ma dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin phyi ma dag la yang ngo //
translated: The same applies to the following.

original: de la rdo rje ni rdo rje dang 'dra ba ste don med par byung ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las so //
analyzed: de la rdo rje ni rdo rje dang 'dra ba ste don med par byung ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las so //
translated: Therein, the vajra is like a vajra, which is the arising of the meaning of non-existence and the obscuration of the afflictions.

original: de'i tsrtsi ka ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i sbyor bas rnam par dpyod pa dang gtso bo zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de'i tsrtsi ka ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i sbyor bas rnam par dpyod pa dang gtso bo zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The Tārā of that is the analysis by the yoga of the absence of one and many, up to the principle.

original: rdo rje phag mo zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang 'dra bas rdo rje ste bha ga las kyi sgrib pa de ma bsgribs so //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang 'dra bas rdo rje ste bha ga las kyi sgrib pa de ma bsgribs so //
translated: The vajra-cow is the vajra because it is like a vajra, and the obscuration of karma is not obscured in the bhaga.

original: de'i aa ni thams cad len zhing rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i aa ni thams cad len zhing rtogs pa'o //
translated: The ā of that is the acceptance and realization of everything.

original: ha ni rab tu byed pa gzhan du bltas te zhes pas ha'o //
analyzed: ha ni rab tu byed pa gzhan du bltas te zhes pas ha'o //
translated: The ha is the other activity, which is seen as ha.

original: pi pi ling la sogs pa'i phyir na di pa'o //
analyzed: pi pi ling la sogs pa'i phyir na di pa'o //
translated: Because of the long pepper, etc., it is dip.

original: rdo rje dbyangs can ma zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes de nyid dbyangs te shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rgyun sel bas na'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyangs can ma zhes bya ba ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes de nyid dbyangs te shes bya'i sgrib pa'i rgyun sel bas na'o //
translated: The one called Vajra Sarasvati is the very same indivisible intuition, which is melody, because it removes the stream of the obscurations of the objects of knowledge.

original: can ni de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: can ni de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The one is the one endowed with that.

original: rdo rje goo ra'i zhes bya ba la rdo rje mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje goo ra'i zhes bya ba la rdo rje mi phyed pa'o //
translated: The one called Vajra Gauri is the indivisible vajra.

original: goo r'i ni stong pa nyid du lta ba ste skye ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goo r'i ni stong pa nyid du lta ba ste skye ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'i phyir ro //
translated: Gauri is the view of emptiness, because it is the antidote to the obscurations of birth.

original: de len zhing 'dzin pa nyid kyis ni rdo rje goo r'i'o //
analyzed: de len zhing 'dzin pa nyid kyis ni rdo rje goo r'i'o //
translated: Because of taking and holding that, it is Vajra Gauri.

original: rdo rje goo r'i ste rang gi don gyi skyon no //🔽grvar zhes pa ni nang gi rim pa'i me dang bden bral la sogs pa'i mtshams rnams su'o //
analyzed: rdo rje goo r'i ste rang gi don gyi skyon no // grvar zhes pa ni nang gi rim pa'i me dang bden bral la sogs pa'i mtshams rnams su'o //
translated: The one called Vajra Gauri is the fault of one's own aim.🔽The corners are the intermediate directions of the inner enclosure, such as the southeast, etc.

original: grva rnams kyis nye bar mtshon nas nang gi 'phar ma'i shar dang lho la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su gti mug gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: grva rnams kyis nye bar mtshon nas nang gi 'phar ma'i shar dang lho la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su gti mug gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Indicated by the corners, in the inner extension, in the east, south, etc., are Delusion Yamantaka, etc.

original: zhe sdang gshin rje gshed ni thams cad kyi dbus su'o ;
analyzed: zhe sdang gshin rje gshed ni thams cad kyi dbus su'o ;
translated: The Hatred Slayer of Death is in the center of all.

original: / tho ba gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi 'phar ma'i shar dang lho la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: / tho ba gshin rje gshed la sogs pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi 'phar ma'i shar dang lho la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: The Sledgehammer Slayer of Death and so forth are in the outer extensions, east, south, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du phyi rol gyi grva rnams su thod pa bzhi po rnams kyang ste phyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol gyi grva rnams su thod pa bzhi po rnams kyang ste phyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in the outer corners, the four skull-cups are to be understood later.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de rnams ni gtso bo ste de la sogs pa dang 'dus @262b pa'o ;
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de rnams ni gtso bo ste de la sogs pa dang 'dus @262b pa'o ;
translated: The phrase and so forth means that they are the principal ones, and so forth, and are assembled.

original: / de re re las rang rang gi sa bon rnams las mtha' yas par spro ba dang bsdu ba rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / de re re las rang rang gi sa bon rnams las mtha' yas par spro ba dang bsdu ba rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that from each of them, from their respective seeds, there is infinite emanation and gathering.

original: de yang bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i sngar gyi dang lhan cig tu blangs te 'brel to //
analyzed: de yang bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i sngar gyi dang lhan cig tu blangs te 'brel to //
translated: And that is connected with the previous phrase they dwell, and is taken together with it.

original: de'i don yang bde ba phun sum tshogs pas de rnams thabs cig tu bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don yang bde ba phun sum tshogs pas de rnams thabs cig tu bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is that they dwell together because of the perfection of bliss.

original: de rnams ni dkyil 'khor gcig la ltos pa'i dbang du byas pa yin la gzhan dag ni gzhan dag la ltos nas dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po dang dkyil 'khor pa yang so so nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni dkyil 'khor gcig la ltos pa'i dbang du byas pa yin la gzhan dag ni gzhan dag la ltos nas dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po dang dkyil 'khor pa yang so so nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: These are in terms of one mandala, but others should be understood as the lords of the mandala and the members of the mandala in terms of others.

original: de dag gi dbye bas ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dbye ba yang ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi dbye bas ni rdo rje sems dpa'i dbye ba yang ngo //
translated: And by their divisions, the divisions of Vajrasattva are also.

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor lha rnams kyi sa bon las bskyed pa'i phyir mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga bstan par gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor lha rnams kyi sa bon las bskyed pa'i phyir mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga bstan par gsungs pa /
translated: Since they are generated from the seed of the deities of the mandala as taught, the five manifest enlightenments are taught.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, etc.

original: de nas yang zhes pa ni dag 'di lta bu nye bar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yang zhes pa ni dag 'di lta bu nye bar brjod pa'o //
translated: Then again means that this kind of purification is expressed.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje bos te zhes bya ba 'dis sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje bos te zhes bya ba 'dis sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Then the Blessed One, having summoned Vajrapāṇi, etc.

original: bos nas zhes pa ni dris pa'o //
analyzed: bos nas zhes pa ni dris pa'o //
translated: Having summoned means having asked.

original: bos pa de yang lan dang rjes su mthun par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bos pa de yang lan dang rjes su mthun par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: And that summoning should be understood in accordance with the reply.

original: gzhan du na ni skabs ma yin par brjod par 'gyur te dri ba gzhan la bstan pa gzhan pas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni skabs ma yin par brjod par 'gyur te dri ba gzhan la bstan pa gzhan pas so //
translated: Otherwise, it would be a matter of a different question and a different answer.

original: gang la bos she na gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang la bos she na gsungs pa /
translated: To whom is it addressed? He says:

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Vajrasattva, etc.

original: thams cad kyang yin la de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang yin la de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since all are thus gone, they are all thus gone, i.e., Akshobhya, etc.

original: de rnams kyi bdag po zhes pa ni de rnams yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag po zhes pa ni de rnams yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
translated: Their lord is the one who speaks of them.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni skyed byed pas so //
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni skyed byed pas so //
translated: Moreover, the thus gone is the producer.

original: lan gyi don gsungs pa ni /🔽de nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas bdud thams cad brlag pa zhes bya ba ste thams cad la 'tshe ba ni brdeg pa'o //
analyzed: lan gyi don gsungs pa ni / de nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas bdud thams cad brlag pa zhes bya ba ste thams cad la 'tshe ba ni brdeg pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the answer is stated:

original: las la aa rkyen du byas pas bdud thams cad de 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: las la aa rkyen du byas pas bdud thams cad de 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Then again, etc., up to the destruction of all demons. All demons are the afflictions of passion, etc.

original: de dag rnam par brlag pa ni rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rnam par brlag pa ni rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Their destruction is purification.

original: de nyid rdo rje ste mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje ste mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the vajra, because it is indivisible.

original: ming ni rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: ming ni rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: The name is well known.

original: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs so //
translated: The samadhi is called the cause, the form of Vajrapani.

original: nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs las zhes pa ni me long lta bu la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'i rang bzhin rnams kyis so //
analyzed: nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs las zhes pa ni me long lta bu la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'i rang bzhin rnams kyis so //
translated: From his body, speech, and mind, that is, from the five aspects of the mirror-like and so forth,

original: nges par phyung ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par spros nas so //
analyzed: nges par phyung ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par spros nas so //
translated: he definitely emitted, that is, emanated,

original: @263a * // zla ba rdo rje rab sbyor bas //
analyzed: @263a * // zla ba rdo rje rab sbyor bas //
translated: the vajra-sun-yoga,

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe snying ga'i sa bon las bkod pa rnams la bdun po rnam par dag pa'i bla na med pa'i mchod pa dang // tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom pa dang / stong pa'i byang chub dang rdo rje ra ba la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe snying ga'i sa bon las bkod pa rnams la bdun po rnam par dag pa'i bla na med pa'i mchod pa dang // tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom pa dang / stong pa'i byang chub dang rdo rje ra ba la sogs pa dang /
translated: that is, when the array of the seven-fold offerings, the unsurpassed worship, the meditation on the four abodes of Brahma, the emptiness of enlightenment, the vajra fence, and so forth, are emanated from the seed syllable at the heart,

original: de'i nang du son pa'i rnam mkha' 'byung ba chen po dang / sna tshogs rdo rje la gnas pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi yang dag par bsdus pa las skyes pa'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus su gnas pa'i nyi ma'i rjes la zla ba rdo rje la sogs pa bsgom pa ste gang 'di lta bu gang 'di lta bu yang
analyzed: de'i nang du son pa'i rnam mkha' 'byung ba chen po dang / sna tshogs rdo rje la gnas pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi yang dag par bsdus pa las skyes pa'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus su gnas pa'i nyi ma'i rjes la zla ba rdo rje la sogs pa bsgom pa ste gang 'di lta bu gang 'di lta bu yang
translated: The great element of space that is within that, and the celestial mansion that arises from the perfect gathering of the four great elements that are located in the vajra cross, in the center of which is the sun, and then the moon, vajra, and so on, which are meditated on in this way,

original: mngon du dkrugs pa'i rim pas bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: mngon du dkrugs pa'i rim pas bstan pa'o ;
translated: are taught in the sequence of the manifest churning.

original: / de lta bu yang brgya lam na gang zhig bla na med par shes rab kyis nga rgyal ba nyid tshig tsam la rab tu 'jug cing de nas dam tshig nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de lta bu yang brgya lam na gang zhig bla na med par shes rab kyis nga rgyal ba nyid tshig tsam la rab tu 'jug cing de nas dam tshig nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is also by chance, since someone who is proud of unsurpassed wisdom will engage in mere words and then will break his commitments.

original: de la zla ba ni a'a li la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la zla ba ni a'a li la sogs pa'o //
translated: There, the moon is the vowels, a, and so on.

original: dbyangs yig bcu drug po rnams kyis nyis 'gyur las 'byung ste me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: dbyangs yig bcu drug po rnams kyis nyis 'gyur las 'byung ste me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: The sixteen vowels arise from the double, which is the mirror-like pristine consciousness.

original: rdo rje zhes pa ni bdud las rgyal ba'i rdo rje ste /
analyzed: rdo rje zhes pa ni bdud las rgyal ba'i rdo rje ste /
translated: The vajra is the vajra of victory over demons.

original: ka la sogs pa gsal byed rnams las yi ge drug lhag pa grangs bzhi bcu nyis 'gyur las byung ba nyi ma'i rdo rje ste mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: ka la sogs pa gsal byed rnams las yi ge drug lhag pa grangs bzhi bcu nyis 'gyur las byung ba nyi ma'i rdo rje ste mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The sun-vajra, which arises from the number of the forty-two times the remainder of the six letters from the consonants beginning with ka, is the gnosis of uniformity.

original: de dag ni zla ba dang nyi ma dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni zla ba dang nyi ma dag go //
translated: Those are the moon and the sun.

original: sbyor ba ni phul du gyur pa ste rab tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni phul du gyur pa ste rab tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: The union is the supreme, the highest union.

original: de nas nyi ma'i steng du h'um yig las rdo rje de'i lte ba la h'um yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma'i steng du h'um yig las rdo rje de'i lte ba la h'um yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Then, on top of the sun, from the letter hum, a vajra, in the center of which is the letter hum, is consecrated; this is the nature of the gnosis of individual discernment.

original: de nas lha'i 'khor lo spro ba dang bsdu bar gyur pa ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de nas lha'i 'khor lo spro ba dang bsdu bar gyur pa ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Then, the emanation and withdrawal of the circle of deities is the nature of the gnosis of successful activity.

original: de dag thams cad zhu ba las yongs su gyur pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad zhu ba las yongs su gyur pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: All of that, melting and transforming, should be understood as the nature of the gnosis of complete purity.

original: gshin rje 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba dang nyi ma dang rdo rje dang sa bon yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa zhu bas bzhengs pa ste /
analyzed: gshin rje 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba dang nyi ma dang rdo rje dang sa bon yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa zhu bas bzhengs pa ste /
translated: The terrifying Yamarī is generated from the moon, sun, vajra, and seed syllable, and then melts.

original: rgyu'i rdo rje 'dzin pa gshin rje gshed po zhabs g-yon brkyang ba sku mdog dkar po rtsa ba'i zhal dkar ba g-yas dang g-yon gyi zhal ni sngo dang dmar ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i rdo rje 'dzin pa gshin rje gshed po zhabs g-yon brkyang ba sku mdog dkar po rtsa ba'i zhal dkar ba g-yas dang g-yon gyi zhal ni sngo dang dmar ba'o //
translated: The causal vajra-holder is the white Yamāri, with his left leg extended, with a white main face, and a left and right face that are blue and red.

original: g-yas pa'i phyag rnams kyis rdo rje dang ral gri dang gri gug 'dzin cing /
analyzed: g-yas pa'i phyag rnams kyis rdo rje dang ral gri dang gri gug 'dzin cing /
translated: He holds a vajra, sword, and flaying knife with his right hands,

original: g-yon pa'i phyag rnams kyis 'khor lo dang padma dang thod pa 'dzin pas rang dang 'dra ba la snyoms par 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i phyag rnams kyis 'khor lo dang padma dang thod pa 'dzin pas rang dang 'dra ba la snyoms par 'khyud pa'o //
translated: and a chakram, lotus, and skull cup with his left hands. He embraces a consort who is similar to himself.

original: de yang @263b bha gar ling+ga rnams gzhag nas //
analyzed: de yang @263b bha gar ling+ga rnams gzhag nas //
translated: Having placed the liṅga in the bhaga,

original: dkyil 'khor bdag po rnam par bsgoms //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bdag po rnam par bsgoms //
translated: one should meditate on the lord of the maṇḍala.

original: zhes le'u bcu pa las gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes le'u bcu pa las gsungs pas so //
translated: This is stated in the tenth chapter.

original: bdud rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bdud rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The demons are of four types:

original: nyon mongs pa dang / lha dang / phung po dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / lha dang / phung po dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud do //
translated: the afflictions, the gods, the aggregates, and the demon of death.

original: rab zhi'i don zhes bya ba ni de'i don du ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rab zhi'i don zhes bya ba ni de'i don du ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: The meaning of “peace” is for that purpose, the fourth.

original: sdang ba thams cad zhi ba zhes bya ba ni sdang ba thams cad ni dgra bo rnams so //
analyzed: sdang ba thams cad zhi ba zhes bya ba ni sdang ba thams cad ni dgra bo rnams so //
translated: “Pacification of all hatred” means all hatred is enemies.

original: zhi ba ni bsal bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni bsal bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: “Peace” is for the purpose of removing.

original: stong pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi rjes la gang bya ba de'i brjod pa gsungs pa bsrung ba'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rdo rje zhes pa ni sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi rjes la gang bya ba de'i brjod pa gsungs pa bsrung ba'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rdo rje zhes pa ni sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
translated: After the enlightenment of emptiness, the statement of what should be done is stated, for the purpose of protection, etc. The “vajra” is the crossed vajra.

original: des na de nyid gsungs pa ;
analyzed: des na de nyid gsungs pa ;
translated: Therefore, that is stated:

original: 'od zer lnga yis 'khrigs pa yi //
analyzed: 'od zer lnga yis 'khrigs pa yi //
translated: “The five light rays are the cloud.”

original: zhes pa ste de yang ram yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'i steng du h'um yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste de yang ram yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'i steng du h'um yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: And that is the complete transformation of RAM into the sun, upon which is the complete HUM.

original: rdo rje sa gzhi zhes bya ba ni rdo rje de nyid las 'od zer du ma byung ba rnams kyis 'og sa gzhi la thug par rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhir gyur pa'o //🔽lcags ri zhes pa ni rdo rje phreng ba'i 'od zer rnams la phyi rol du ra bgru bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sa gzhi zhes bya ba ni rdo rje de nyid las 'od zer du ma byung ba rnams kyis 'og sa gzhi la thug par rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhir gyur pa'o // lcags ri zhes pa ni rdo rje phreng ba'i 'od zer rnams la phyi rol du ra bgru bzhi pa'o //
translated: The “vajra ground” is the ground below, which is made of vajras by the light rays that come from those vajras.🔽The “iron fence” is the outer square enclosure of the light rays of the vajra garland.

original: ra ba zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i sa gzhi'i steng gi phyogs bzhi 'od zer rnams las byung ba'i rtsig pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: ra ba zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i sa gzhi'i steng gi phyogs bzhi 'od zer rnams las byung ba'i rtsig pa bzhi'o //
translated: The “wall” is the four walls that arise from the light rays in the four directions above the vajra ground.

original: gur zhes pa ni nam mkha'i phyogs su rdo rje'i 'od zer rnams kyis khyab ste thog phub pa'o //
analyzed: gur zhes pa ni nam mkha'i phyogs su rdo rje'i 'od zer rnams kyis khyab ste thog phub pa'o //
translated: The “canopy” is the covering of the sky with vajra light rays, like a roof.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rdzogs pa'i rjes la bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rdzogs pa'i rjes la bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: After the completion of Vajrasattva, the following is taught:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad skyed pa po ni rdo rje sems dpa' rgyu'i rdo rje 'dzin pa ni gshin rje gshed po'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad skyed pa po ni rdo rje sems dpa' rgyu'i rdo rje 'dzin pa ni gshin rje gshed po'o //
translated: “Then” and so forth. The “creator of all the tathāgatas” is Vajrasattva. The “causal vajra holder” is Yamāntaka.

original: bdud rlag par byed pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bdud rlag par byed pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs zhes pa ni /
translated: The samadhi called “vajra that destroys Mara” means that

original: rang gi snying ga nas 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bkug cing khar zhugs nas snying gar zhu bar bya ste /🔽rdo rje'i lam nas byung ba dang / rang dang 'dra ba'i padmar zla ba zhu ba'i gzugs kyis dkyil 'khor pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams la rdzogs pa'i lha mo'i 'khor lo ni bdud rlag par byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas rgyu la 'bras bu'i ming btags nas bdud rlag par byed pa'i rdo rje
analyzed: rang gi snying ga nas 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bkug cing khar zhugs nas snying gar zhu bar bya ste / rdo rje'i lam nas byung ba dang / rang dang 'dra ba'i padmar zla ba zhu ba'i gzugs kyis dkyil 'khor pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams la rdzogs pa'i lha mo'i 'khor lo ni bdud rlag par byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas rgyu la 'bras bu'i ming btags nas bdud rlag par byed pa'i rdo rje
translated: having summoned the tathagatas with light rays from one’s heart, they enter one’s mouth and melt at the heart.🔽Having emerged from the vajra path, in the form of the moon that has melted in the lotus that is similar to oneself, the wheel of perfect goddesses is the cause of destroying Mara.

original: zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni de dag nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni de dag nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the cause is designated with the name of the result, and the samadhi called “vajra that destroys Mara” is just those.

original: nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje rnams las zhes bya ba ni rang dang 'dra bar son pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa gsum gyi rnam par dag pa'i chos @264a * //
analyzed: nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje rnams las zhes bya ba ni rang dang 'dra bar son pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa gsum gyi rnam par dag pa'i chos @264a * //
translated: From his vajra body, speech, and mind, means from the nature of his body, speech, and mind, which is similar to himself, the three Tathagatas, the source of the Dharma of purity.

original: kyi 'byung gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyi 'byung gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the word “source” is “origin.”

original: nges par phyung zhes bya ba ni yang dag par spros te gnas ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par bkod pa ste /
analyzed: nges par phyung zhes bya ba ni yang dag par spros te gnas ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par bkod pa ste /
translated: “Having emerged” means having emanated, having been arranged in their proper places.

original: gti mug gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i sa bon spros pa'i gnas skabs las so //
analyzed: gti mug gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i sa bon spros pa'i gnas skabs las so //
translated: From the state of the emanation of the seed syllables of Mohavajra and so on.

original: dbus su ya zhes pa ni gtso bo gshin rje gshed kyi sa bon du ya shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus su ya zhes pa ni gtso bo gshin rje gshed kyi sa bon du ya shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the center, the seed syllable of the principal figure, Yamantaka, is understood by implication to be ya.

original: zhu bar gyur pa las gshin rje gshed yin la /
analyzed: zhu bar gyur pa las gshin rje gshed yin la /
translated: From the state of the syllable ya, Yamantaka arises.

original: de'i tshe sa bon yi ger bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe sa bon yi ger bya'o //
translated: At that time, the seed syllable is to be made into a syllable.

original: da ni ya kshe ma med la sogs pa nyid spros te gnas nas ji lta ba rnams su'o //
analyzed: da ni ya kshe ma med la sogs pa nyid spros te gnas nas ji lta ba rnams su'o //
translated: Now, ya, kshe, ma, me, and so on, having emanated, are in their proper places.

original: kshe ma med dag ni nang gi rim pa'i phyogs su gnas pa ste lhag ma'o //
analyzed: kshe ma med dag ni nang gi rim pa'i phyogs su gnas pa ste lhag ma'o //
translated: The KṢE letters are in the inner circle, the rest.

original: ya dza ni ra ni phyi rol gyi sgo bzhi po rnams su'o //
analyzed: ya dza ni ra ni phyi rol gyi sgo bzhi po rnams su'o //
translated: The YAJ letters are in the four outer doors.

original: dza sa do ru ni nang gi rim pa'i mtshams rnams su'o //
analyzed: dza sa do ru ni nang gi rim pa'i mtshams rnams su'o //
translated: The SA letters are in the inner circle’s corners.

original: na yo ni r'a ni phyi rol gyi rim pa'i grva bzhi po rnams su'o //
analyzed: na yo ni r'a ni phyi rol gyi rim pa'i grva bzhi po rnams su'o //
translated: The NO letters are in the four outer corners.

original: lha'i dbye bas sa bon gyi yi ge'i rnam par dbye ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: lha'i dbye bas sa bon gyi yi ge'i rnam par dbye ba gsungs pa /
translated: The seed syllables are divided by the deities.

original: ra sogs dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ra sogs dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The first of the R and so forth.

original: gshin rje gshed ces bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed ces bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The one called “Slayer of Yama” is Akṣobhya.

original: gti mug ces bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: gti mug ces bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The one called “delusion” is Vairocana.

original: phra ma zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: phra ma zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The one called “malice” is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: 'dod chags zhes pa ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhes pa ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: The one called “passion” is Amitābha.

original: phrag dog ces pa ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: phrag dog ces pa ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The one called “jealousy” is Amoghasiddhi.

original: gshin rje 'joms pa lnga ru grags //
analyzed: gshin rje 'joms pa lnga ru grags //
translated: The five are renowned as “Slayer of Yama.”

original: zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de nyid la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de nyid la /
translated: The five are Akṣobhya and so forth.

original: gshin rje 'joms pa lnga ru grags //
analyzed: gshin rje 'joms pa lnga ru grags //
translated: The five are renowned as “Slayer of Yama.”

original: zhes mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: This is the recitation.

original: de'i rjes la phyag rgya'i skabs su dkyil 'khor pa thams cad kyi dbu la gshin rje 'joms pa bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rjes la phyag rgya'i skabs su dkyil 'khor pa thams cad kyi dbu la gshin rje 'joms pa bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni /
translated: After that, in the section on the seal, one should meditate on Yamântaka on the head of all the maòçalas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ji ltar rigs pa bsgom par bya zhes pa'o//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ji ltar rigs pa bsgom par bya zhes pa'o//
translated: This means that one should meditate on the Tathâgata himself, as is appropriate.

original: da ni rdo rje'i ra ba dang rdo rje'i gur gyi nang du gnas pa'i nam mkha'i bdag nyid kyis stong par 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus su gshin rje gshed po bzhugs pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje'i ra ba dang rdo rje'i gur gyi nang du gnas pa'i nam mkha'i bdag nyid kyis stong par 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus su gshin rje gshed po bzhugs pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to explain the palace, which is to be described as being in the sky in the middle of the vajra fence and vajra tent, he says,

original: nam mkha' rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs te de la nam mkha' rdo rje ni nam mkha' 'byung ba chen po ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs te de la nam mkha' rdo rje ni nam mkha' 'byung ba chen po ste /
translated: in the middle of the sky-vajra, etc. There, the sky-vajra is the great element of space.

original: rdo rje ra ba dang rdo rje'i gur gyi nang du gnas pa'i nam mkha'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo rje ra ba dang rdo rje'i gur gyi nang du gnas pa'i nam mkha'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the sky, which is in the middle of the vajra fence and vajra tent.

original: de'i dbus su ni der khyab ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dbus su ni der khyab ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the middle of that, one should meditate on the palace, which is to pervade it, is the meaning.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje zhes pa ni h'um yig las skyes pa sngar gyi sna tshogs rdo rje nyid do //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje zhes pa ni h'um yig las skyes pa sngar gyi sna tshogs rdo rje nyid do //
translated: The “vajra cross” is the vajra cross arisen from the syllable hūṃ, as before.

original: bsam zhes pa ni dran pa ste /
analyzed: bsam zhes pa ni dran pa ste /
translated: “Think” means “remember.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid las dbus su nag @264b po dang / shar du dkar po dang / lhor ser po dang / nub tu dmar po dang / nub tu dmar po dang / byang du ljang gu dang / de yi dkyil bzhugs gshin rje gshed //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid las dbus su nag @264b po dang / shar du dkar po dang / lhor ser po dang / nub tu dmar po dang / nub tu dmar po dang / byang du ljang gu dang / de yi dkyil bzhugs gshin rje gshed //
translated: From the nature of the five tathāgatas, in the center is black, in the east is white, in the south is yellow, in the west is red, in the north is green, and in the intermediate directions is smoke-colored,🔽and in the center of that is Yamāntaka.

original: ces bya ba ni sna tshogs rdo rje de'i mu khyud du gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sna tshogs rdo rje de'i mu khyud du gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang gi dbus su gnas pa'o //
translated: This means that he is in the center of the celestial mansion situated on the periphery of the vajra cross.

original: gzhan yang rdo rje sems dpa' zhu bar gyur pa las rdo rje'i glus bskul nas bzhengs par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rdo rje sems dpa' zhu bar gyur pa las rdo rje'i glus bskul nas bzhengs par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should understand that he is aroused by the vajra song of the transformation of Vajrasattva.

original: shar rtsibs pa zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs kyi cha'o //
analyzed: shar rtsibs pa zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs kyi cha'o //
translated: The “eastern spoke” is the eastern part.

original: de bzhin du lho dang nub dang byang gi phyogs kyi char yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang nub dang byang gi phyogs kyi char yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the southern, western, and northern parts.

original: mtshams zhes bya ba ni nang gi rim pa'i grva rnams su'o //
analyzed: mtshams zhes bya ba ni nang gi rim pa'i grva rnams su'o //
translated: The interstices are the corners of the inner enclosure.

original: rdo rje rtsibs bzhi la zhes bya ba ni rdo rje ni gti mug rdo rje gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rtsibs bzhi la zhes bya ba ni rdo rje ni gti mug rdo rje gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'o //
translated: The four vajra-tips are the tips of the vajras of Mohavajra-Yamântaka, etc.

original: de rnams kyi rtse mo ni chos kyi brda grva rnams su'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rtse mo ni chos kyi brda grva rnams su'o //
translated: They are the sign-symbols of the Dharma in the corners.

original: tsrtsi ka la sogs zhes bya ba ni tsrtsi ka dang / phag mo dang / dbyangs can ma dang / goo ri ma'o //
analyzed: tsrtsi ka la sogs zhes bya ba ni tsrtsi ka dang / phag mo dang / dbyangs can ma dang / goo ri ma'o //
translated: The four goddesses, etc., are Cârul, Varâhî, Mârici, and Gaurî.🔽The four door-tips are the four tips of the four-sided vajra-crosses at the outer door-threshold.

original: sgo bzhi rtse zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi 'phar ma'i sgo ru gang sna tshogs rdo rje'i rtse mo bzhi ste rtse mo lnga pa rnam pa bzhi'o//
analyzed: sgo bzhi rtse zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi 'phar ma'i sgo ru gang sna tshogs rdo rje'i rtse mo bzhi ste rtse mo lnga pa rnam pa bzhi'o//
translated: They are the tips of the four five-pointed vajras.

original: de dang nye bar gyur pa'i sgo nyid du zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de dang nye bar gyur pa'i sgo nyid du zhes pa'i don to //
translated: They are near the door means that they are at the door-threshold.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje'i grva rnams su zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs rdo rje la gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang gi grva rnams su'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje'i grva rnams su zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs rdo rje la gnas pa'i gzhal yas khang gi grva rnams su'o //
translated: The corners of the vajra-cross are the corners of the celestial palace located on the vajra-cross.

original: mi'i mgo bo ni skyes pa'i thod pa khrag gis gang ba rnams te sna tshogs padma'i steng du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i mgo bo ni skyes pa'i thod pa khrag gis gang ba rnams te sna tshogs padma'i steng du gnas pa'o //
translated: The human heads are skulls filled with blood, and they are located on top of the variegated lotus.

original: lha rnams kyi sngags kyi bzlas pa bstan pa'i don du de nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi sngags kyi bzlas pa bstan pa'i don du de nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to teach the mantra recitation of the deities, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then again,” and so forth.

original: gshin rje gshed rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gshin rje gshed 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs thob ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gshin rje gshed 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs thob ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having entered into the vajra-Yamântaka meditative absorption, [means] having attained the state of the arising of the resultant Yamântaka.

original: sngags bzlas zhes pa lhag ma'o ;
analyzed: sngags bzlas zhes pa lhag ma'o ;
translated: The mantra recitation is the remainder.

original: / gsungs zhes pa ni da lta nyid du gsungs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: / gsungs zhes pa ni da lta nyid du gsungs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The declaration is the declaration that will occur right now.

original: dkyil 'khor pa'i bzlas pa'i sngags gsungs pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa'i bzlas pa'i sngags gsungs pa /
translated: The mantra of the maṇḍala recitation is stated.

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bcu gnyis po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig bcu gnyis po rnams kyis so //
translated: That, and so forth, with the twelve terms.

original: sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po dang dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po dang dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The mantra of the consecration of body, speech, and mind is the [mantra] of the maṇḍala lord and the maṇḍala retinue.

original: zhe sdang chen po'i sku zhes pa ni zhe sdang gshin rje gshed kyi sku'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang chen po'i sku zhes pa ni zhe sdang gshin rje gshed kyi sku'o //
translated: The body of great hatred is the body of Yamântaka of Hatred.

original: zhal gsum zhes pa ni rtsa ba nag po dang / g-yas dkar po dang / g-yon dmar po'o //
analyzed: zhal gsum zhes pa ni rtsa ba nag po dang / g-yas dkar po dang / g-yon dmar po'o //
translated: The three faces are the black root face, the white right face, and the red left face.

original: phyag ces pa ni g-yas pa'i phyag na rdo rjes nye bar mtshan pa'i phyir ro //🔽phyag @265a * //
analyzed: phyag ces pa ni g-yas pa'i phyag na rdo rjes nye bar mtshan pa'i phyir ro // phyag @265a * //
translated: The six arms are marked by the vajra in the right hand.

original: gzhan gnyis na ral gri dang gri gug 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gnyis na ral gri dang gri gug 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The other two hands hold a sword and a flaying knife.

original: de bzhin du g-yon pa'i phyag gsum na 'khor lo dang padma dmar po dang thod pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon pa'i phyag gsum na 'khor lo dang padma dmar po dang thod pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the three left hands hold a wheel, a red lotus, and a skull cup.

original: zhal gsum pa zhes rtsa ba nag po dang / g-yon pa dmar po dang / g-yas nag po'o //
analyzed: zhal gsum pa zhes rtsa ba nag po dang / g-yon pa dmar po dang / g-yas nag po'o //
translated: The three faces are the black root face, the red left face, and the white right face.

original: zhi ba ni zhi ba'i las kyis phan pa'o//
analyzed: zhi ba ni zhi ba'i las kyis phan pa'o//
translated: Pacifying is the benefit of the pacifying activity.

original: gsal ba'i gzugs ni zla ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i gzugs ni zla ba'o //
translated: The form of the moon is clear.

original: de dang mnyam pa'i 'od zer dkar po'o //
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa'i 'od zer dkar po'o //
translated: It has white light rays equal to the moon.

original: phyag ces pa ni g-yas pa ste 'khor los nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyag ces pa ni g-yas pa ste 'khor los nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir /
translated: The six arms are marked by the wheel in the right hand.

original: phyag gzhan gnyis su yang ral gri dang gri gug 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag gzhan gnyis su yang ral gri dang gri gug 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The other two hands hold a sword and a flaying knife.

original: de bzhin du g-yon pa'i phyag gsum na rin po che dang padma dang thod pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon pa'i phyag gsum na rin po che dang padma dang thod pa rnams so //
translated: Likewise, in the three left hands are a jewel, lotus, and skull-cup.

original: zhal gsum zhes pa ni rtsa ba ser po dang / g-yas dkar po dang / g-yon nag po'o //
analyzed: zhal gsum zhes pa ni rtsa ba ser po dang / g-yas dkar po dang / g-yon nag po'o //
translated: The three faces are the yellow main face, the white right face, and the black left face.

original: rgyas pa ni rgyas pa'i las kyi phan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni rgyas pa'i las kyi phan pa'o //
translated: The expansion is the benefit of the action of expansion.

original: gser bsreg pa'i rnam pa zhes pa ni bsregs pas mdog bzang po ste de'i 'od do //
analyzed: gser bsreg pa'i rnam pa zhes pa ni bsregs pas mdog bzang po ste de'i 'od do //
translated: The color of refined gold is the good color of the refined gold, and its light.

original: phyag ces pa ni g-yas pa na rin po ches nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyag ces pa ni g-yas pa na rin po ches nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir /
translated: The hand is the right hand, which is indicated by the jewel.

original: gzhan gyi phyag gnyis su yang ral gri dang gri gug go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyag gnyis su yang ral gri dang gri gug go //
translated: In the other two hands are a sword and a flaying knife.

original: g-yon pa'i phyag gsum na 'khor lo dang padma dang thod pa rnams so //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i phyag gsum na 'khor lo dang padma dang thod pa rnams so //
translated: In the three left hands are a wheel, lotus, and skull-cup.

original: zhal gsum zhes pa ni rtsa ba dmar po dang / g-yas dkar po dang / g-yon sngon po'o //
analyzed: zhal gsum zhes pa ni rtsa ba dmar po dang / g-yas dkar po dang / g-yon sngon po'o //
translated: The three faces are the red main face, the white right face, and the blue left face.

original: dbang ni dbang du byed pa'i las kyi phan pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ni dbang du byed pa'i las kyi phan pa'o //
translated: The power is the benefit of the action of power.

original: padma r'a ga zhes pa ni rin po che dmar po'o //
analyzed: padma r'a ga zhes pa ni rin po che dmar po'o //
translated: The padma-rāga is a red jewel.

original: phyag ni g-yas pa na padmas nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyag ni g-yas pa na padmas nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir /
translated: The right hand is marked with a lotus.

original: phyag gnyis su yang ral gri dang gri gug go //
analyzed: phyag gnyis su yang ral gri dang gri gug go //
translated: The two hands hold a sword and flaying knife.

original: g-yon par ni 'khor lo dang rin po che dang thod pa rnams so //
analyzed: g-yon par ni 'khor lo dang rin po che dang thod pa rnams so //
translated: The left holds a wheel, jewel, and skull-cup.

original: zhal gsum zhes pa ni rtsa ba ljang gu dang / g-yas nag po dang / g-yon ser po'o //
analyzed: zhal gsum zhes pa ni rtsa ba ljang gu dang / g-yas nag po dang / g-yon ser po'o //
translated: The three faces are green, black, and yellow.

original: thams cad ni las thams cad pa'o//
analyzed: thams cad ni las thams cad pa'o//
translated: All are for all activities.

original: margad ni rin po che ljang gu'o //
analyzed: margad ni rin po che ljang gu'o //
translated: The emerald is a green jewel.

original: phyag g-yas pa'i phyag na shugs can te ral gris nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa'i phyag na shugs can te ral gris nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir /
translated: The right hand is powerful, marked with a sword.

original: phyag gzhan gnyis su yang rdo rje dang gri gug go //
analyzed: phyag gzhan gnyis su yang rdo rje dang gri gug go //
translated: The other two hands hold a vajra and flaying knife.

original: g-yon pa ni 'khor lo dang padma dang thod pa rnams so //
analyzed: g-yon pa ni 'khor lo dang padma dang thod pa rnams so //
translated: The left holds a wheel, lotus, and skull-cup.

original: de ltar nang gi rim par gnas pa'i gshin rje gshed po lnga gsungs nas ;
analyzed: de ltar nang gi rim par gnas pa'i gshin rje gshed po lnga gsungs nas ;
translated: Thus, having described the five Yamantakas residing in the inner circle,

original: le'u rdzogs par gsungs pa /
analyzed: le'u rdzogs par gsungs pa /
translated: the chapter is concluded.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning Thus have I heard and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gang sku dang / gsung dang / thugs ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gang sku dang / gsung dang / thugs ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: The one who is the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas is called Vajrasattva.

original: gang de yongs su gyur pa ni gshin rje gshed nag po ste de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams @265b cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: gang de yongs su gyur pa ni gshin rje gshed nag po ste de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams @265b cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs gshin rje gshed do //
translated: The one who is the transformation of that is called black Yamantaka, and he is the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas.

original: de nyid rgyud de dag gsal bar byed pa ga la yod pa de ni rgyud do //
analyzed: de nyid rgyud de dag gsal bar byed pa ga la yod pa de ni rgyud do //
translated: How can that very [Vajrasattva] be the tantra that illuminates those [bodies, speech, and mind]? It is the tantra.

original: de las zhes pa ni phyogs gcig pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes pa ni phyogs gcig pa las so //
translated: From that means from one part.

original: mngon par zhen pa ni mngon par dang ba thams cad las te /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ni mngon par dang ba thams cad las te /
translated: Attachment is from all attachments.

original: thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis yang dag par thob cing mngon du byed kyi rang bzhin gyis gang thob pa de lta bu ni mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis yang dag par thob cing mngon du byed kyi rang bzhin gyis gang thob pa de lta bu ni mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of all is truly attained and realized, and that which is attained by nature is like that realization.

original: mi shes pa kun gyi sgrib g-yogs pa'i snam bu dang 'dra bas snam bu'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa kun gyi sgrib g-yogs pa'i snam bu dang 'dra bas snam bu'o //
translated: It is a cloth because it is like a cloth that covers the obscurations of all ignorance.

original: der len zhing 'dzin pas na le'u'o //
analyzed: der len zhing 'dzin pas na le'u'o //
translated: It is a chapter because it is taken up and held there.

original: mngon par rtogs pa yang 'di yin la le'u yang 'di yin pas mngon par rtogs pa'i le'u'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa yang 'di yin la le'u yang 'di yin pas mngon par rtogs pa'i le'u'o //
translated: This is the clear realization, and this is a chapter, so it is the chapter on clear realization.

original: le'u dang po'i bshad ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u dang po'i bshad ba rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the first chapter is complete.

original: // / slob ma la sogs pa'i dbang du bya ste dkyil 'khor bri ba la sogs pa'i don du slob dpon la bstod pa brjod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / slob ma la sogs pa'i dbang du bya ste dkyil 'khor bri ba la sogs pa'i don du slob dpon la bstod pa brjod pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to explain the disciples and so forth, for the sake of drawing the mandala and so forth, the praise of the master is stated:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Great Vajrasattva,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' chen po zhes pa la chen po ni thams cad sdud par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' chen po zhes pa la chen po ni thams cad sdud par mdzad pa'o //
translated: the Great One is the one who includes everything.

original: rdo rje ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: Vajra is by the nature of enlightenment.

original: de skad du //🔽byang chub sems gang de rdo rje //
analyzed: de skad du // byang chub sems gang de rdo rje //
translated: Thus it is said:

original: zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: That which is the thought of enlightenment is the vajra.

original: de la sems dpa'i ni gang yod pa'i phyir dang / de'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sems dpa'i ni gang yod pa'i phyir dang / de'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists, and because it is its nature, it is the sattva.

original: bstod pa gang gi bstod ce na gsungs pa gti mug rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bstod pa gang gi bstod ce na gsungs pa gti mug rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To what is the praise? It is said: Delusion Vajra, and so forth.

original: lha'i 'khor lo bsgoms pa'i rjes la mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par gsungs pa /
analyzed: lha'i 'khor lo bsgoms pa'i rjes la mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par gsungs pa /
translated: After meditating on the wheel of the deity, it is said that one should consecrate the eyes, etc.

original: rdo rje mi gces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje mi gces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said that one should recite the mantra beginning with “vajra-netra,” etc.

original: gsungs pa zhes pa ni gsungs nas so //
analyzed: gsungs pa zhes pa ni gsungs nas so //
translated: “It is said” means that it is said.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams byin gyis brlabs nas gang de'i dam tshig ni brda ste mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams byin gyis brlabs nas gang de'i dam tshig ni brda ste mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Having consecrated the eyes, etc., the pledge is the symbol, the meaning of which is the mantra for consecrating the eyes, etc.

original: glegs bam la lar ni dang po'i mtha' can gyi tshig go //
analyzed: glegs bam la lar ni dang po'i mtha' can gyi tshig go //
translated: In some texts, the mantra is preceded by “oṃ.”

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i dam tshig gang gis bcom ldan 'das zhes pa'o //🔽khyad par blangs te 'gro ba'i phyir so sor byed pa 'bru mang po par bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i dam tshig gang gis bcom ldan 'das zhes pa'o // khyad par blangs te 'gro ba'i phyir so sor byed pa 'bru mang po par bsdu ba'o //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: “The pledge of consecrating the eyes, etc., is the mantra of the Bhagavān.”🔽The word “also” is used to include the other senses.

original: de ltar na ni phyi nas kyang de lta bu'i tshig tu rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ni phyi nas kyang de lta bu'i tshig tu rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that such words are also used later.

original: bstod pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa dkyil 'khor bri bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: bstod pa gsungs pa'i dgongs pa dkyil 'khor bri bar gsungs pa /
translated: The intention of the praise is stated in the description of the drawing of the maṇḍala.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then, having consecrated the fierce one,

original: 'joms zhes pa ni rab tu gtum par byin gyis brlabs nas so //🔽dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni byang chub sems @266a * //
analyzed: 'joms zhes pa ni rab tu gtum par byin gyis brlabs nas so // dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni byang chub sems @266a * //
translated: he should draw the mandala of the wrathful one,

original: kyi rang bzhin yin pas na'o //
analyzed: kyi rang bzhin yin pas na'o //
translated: which is the nature of bodhicitta.

original: de skad du yang dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las /
analyzed: de skad du yang dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las /
translated: And thus it is said in the Shri Guhyasamaja:

original: byang chub sems ni dkyil 'khor ro //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni dkyil 'khor ro // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Bodhicitta is the mandala.

original: gshin rje'i dgra ni gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: gshin rje'i dgra ni gshin rje gshed do //
translated: And Yama is Yamantaka.

original: de dang rab mtshungs ni de dang 'dra pa ste der bya ba dang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang rab mtshungs ni de dang 'dra pa ste der bya ba dang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Being similar to him, he is like him, because he is the agent and the action.

original: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub par byed //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub par byed //
translated: He accomplishes all desired aims.

original: ces bya ba ni gang 'dod pa'i don ji srid pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gang 'dod pa'i don ji srid pa ste /
translated: Whatever the desired aim, to the extent that it is, he accomplishes it,

original: zhi ba la sogs pa der sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa der sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: whether it be peace and so forth.

original: khyad par ni dbus na bzhugs pa'i sku mdog dang mtshan ma la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: khyad par ni dbus na bzhugs pa'i sku mdog dang mtshan ma la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: The difference is by the division of the color, insignia, and so forth of the body of the one who is in the center.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi thig skud gsungs pa sa tva zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi thig skud gsungs pa sa tva zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The thread of the mandala is stated with “satva,” and so forth.

original: legs par bsgrubs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: legs par bsgrubs zhes pa ni /
translated: “Well-prepared” means

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnam par dag pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnam par dag pa lnga ste /
translated: the five thus-gone ones are the five purities.

original: skud pa rnam pa wa kha dog rnam pa lngar byas pa'i nyi shu rtsa lnga bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: skud pa rnam pa wa kha dog rnam pa lngar byas pa'i nyi shu rtsa lnga bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: The thread is made of five colors, each twenty-five [strands].

original: legs pa'i tshad la zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi nyis 'gyur gyis ring bas so //
analyzed: legs pa'i tshad la zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi nyis 'gyur gyis ring bas so //
translated: “The right measure” means it is twice the size of the maṇḍala.

original: mdzes pa zhes pa ni rab tu legs pa na'o//
analyzed: mdzes pa zhes pa ni rab tu legs pa na'o//
translated: “Beautiful” means it is very good.

original: sboms su ni dkyil 'khor gyi sgo'i nyi shu cha zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sboms su ni dkyil 'khor gyi sgo'i nyi shu cha zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “In thickness” means one-twentieth the size of the maṇḍala door.

original: skud pa zhes pa ni sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa las byas pa'i ye shes kyi skud pa'o //
analyzed: skud pa zhes pa ni sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa las byas pa'i ye shes kyi skud pa'o //
translated: “Thread” means the thread of gnosis made from the empowered mantra.

original: thig gdab ces bya ba la man ngag 'di yin te /
analyzed: thig gdab ces bya ba la man ngag 'di yin te /
translated: “To cast the lines” means the following.

original: dkyil 'khor khru gang pa'i dbang du byas nas khru gsum pa'i cha la gru bzhi legs par byas la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor khru gang pa'i dbang du byas nas khru gsum pa'i cha la gru bzhi legs par byas la /
translated: In terms of a one-cubit maṇḍala, make a square with three cubits.

original: dbus kyi char lag pa g-yon pa'i mthe bong dang mdzub mos skud pa bzung nas lag pa g-yas pas rdo rgyus dang bcas pa'i skud pa'i rtse mo bzung ste ri mo zlum po gcig kun nas bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi char lag pa g-yon pa'i mthe bong dang mdzub mos skud pa bzung nas lag pa g-yas pas rdo rgyus dang bcas pa'i skud pa'i rtse mo bzung ste ri mo zlum po gcig kun nas bskor bar bya'o //
translated: In the center, holding the thread with the thumb and index finger of the left hand, and holding the end of the thread with the right hand together with the stylus, one should draw a complete circle.

original: de nas shar dang / nub dang / byang dang / lho ru slob dpon dang slob ma mngon par phyogs pa yang mi bskyod pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad kyi lha'i bdag nyid du byas pa'i rnal 'byor pas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du dbus kyi char tshangs thig gnyis gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas shar dang / nub dang / byang dang / lho ru slob dpon dang slob ma mngon par phyogs pa yang mi bskyod pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad kyi lha'i bdag nyid du byas pa'i rnal 'byor pas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du dbus kyi char tshangs thig gnyis gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then, facing east, west, north, and south, the master and the disciple, the yogī who has taken on the identity of Akṣobhya and Vairocana, respectively, should lay down two Brahmā lines in the center in the proper order.

original: de bzhin du rlung dang // me dang / dbang ldan dang / bden bral du gnas la mtshams kyi thig gnyis kyang gdab ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung dang // me dang / dbang ldan dang / bden bral du gnas la mtshams kyi thig gnyis kyang gdab ste /
translated: Similarly, standing in the northeast, southeast, southwest, and northwest, they should lay down two intermediate lines.

original: de dag gi bar dag kyang mnyam pa dang tshad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bar dag kyang mnyam pa dang tshad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those lines should be equal and of proper measure.

original: de'i dbus su dang po rkang pa gcig gis mchog pa'i sor mo bcu nas bzung ste ri mo zlum po gcig kun nas bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su dang po rkang pa gcig gis mchog pa'i sor mo bcu nas bzung ste ri mo zlum po gcig kun nas bskor bar bya'o //
translated: In the middle of that, beginning with one foot, one should draw a complete circle from the ten toes.
