original: 'khrul 'khor bsros zhes pa ni thod pa kha sbyar nas bton te bzlas pa dang 'khrul 'khor yang dag par rtsom mo //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor bsros zhes pa ni thod pa kha sbyar nas bton te bzlas pa dang 'khrul 'khor yang dag par rtsom mo //
translated: The heated machine is a joined skull cup, from which one recites and begins the machine.

original: bsro ba'i tshe sngags kyi bzlas pa ni sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: bsro ba'i tshe sngags kyi bzlas pa ni sngar bzhin no //
translated: At the time of heating, the recitation of the mantra is as before.

original: rengs par bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /🔽yung ba yi ni khu ba yis //
analyzed: rengs par bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa / yung ba yi ni khu ba yis //
translated: For the sake of teaching paralysis, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: With the juice of indigo plant, and so on.

original: yung ba ni rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: yung ba ni rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: The “black” is well known.

original: khu ba ni ba bla'o //
analyzed: khu ba ni ba bla'o //
translated: The “juice” is the urine.

original: de dag gis yang dag par bris te kham phor kha sbyar gyi nang du bcug la kham phor ser po'i steng du ri mo bri bar bya'o zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de dag gis yang dag par bris te kham phor kha sbyar gyi nang du bcug la kham phor ser po'i steng du ri mo bri bar bya'o zhes 'brel to //
translated: Having written those, one should place them in a joined pair of bowls, and draw the picture on top of the yellow bowl.

original: de yi steng du mnyam par bri //
analyzed: de yi steng du mnyam par bri //
translated: One should draw it evenly on top of that.

original: zhes pa ni ri mo bzhi'am /
analyzed: zhes pa ni ri mo bzhi'am /
translated: This is the four or seven line drawing.

original: bdun gyi ri mo'i thog tu bsgom par bya ba ni ri mo nyid rgya mtsho'i bdag nyid kyis bskor ba'i ri rab bsgom par bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdun gyi ri mo'i thog tu bsgom par bya ba ni ri mo nyid rgya mtsho'i bdag nyid kyis bskor ba'i ri rab bsgom par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “one should meditate on top of the drawing” is that one should meditate on Mount Meru surrounded by the nature of the ocean.

original: ri rab 'di yis brten par bya //🔽zhes pa ni ri rab kyi steng du hum yig blta bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: ri rab 'di yis brten par bya // zhes pa ni ri rab kyi steng du hum yig blta bar bya ba ste /
translated: One should rely on this Mount Meru.🔽The meaning of “on top of Mount Meru” is that one should visualize the syllable hūṃ.

original: sgrub pa po'i dbang du byas pa'i g-yon phyogs kyi char ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i dbang du byas pa'i g-yon phyogs kyi char ro //
translated: This is from the perspective of the practitioner’s left side.

original: cha gzhan du yam bam yig ste /
analyzed: cha gzhan du yam bam yig ste /
translated: In the other part, there is the syllable yaṃ vaṃ.

original: sgrub pa po'i lus kyi dbang du byas te g-yas phyogs kyi char ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i lus kyi dbang du byas te g-yas phyogs kyi char ro //
translated: This is from the perspective of the practitioner’s body on the right side.

original: de'i steng du zhes pa ni ri rab kyi 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du zhes pa ni ri rab kyi 'og tu'o //
translated: “On top of that” is below Mount Meru.

original: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni sa'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni sa'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The “maṇḍala of the great lord” is the maṇḍala of earth.

original: gru bzhi mdog ser po gra rnams su rdo rje rtse gsum pas mtshan pa'o //🔽sna tshogs rdo rjes mnan pa la //
analyzed: gru bzhi mdog ser po gra rnams su rdo rje rtse gsum pas mtshan pa'o // sna tshogs rdo rjes mnan pa la //
translated: It is square, yellow in color, and marked with three-tined vajras on the corners.🔽It is pressed down with a vajra cross.

original: zhes bya ba @272b ni sna tshogs rdo rjes mnan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba @272b ni sna tshogs rdo rjes mnan pa'o //
translated: This means that it is pressed down with a vajra cross.

original: sa 'og tu sna tshogs rdo rjes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa 'og tu sna tshogs rdo rjes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is pressed down with a vajra cross below the earth.

original: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la bzhengs pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la bzhengs pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa bsgoms pa'o //
translated: “Standing on the maṇḍala of the great lord” means meditating on oneself standing on the maṇḍala of the great lord.

original: bsgrub bya rnams bsams ni sna tshogs rdo rje'i 'og tu zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya rnams bsams ni sna tshogs rdo rje'i 'og tu zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: “Having visualized the objects of attainment” means below the vajra cross.

original: ri bo rnams zhes pa ni ri rab nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ri bo rnams zhes pa ni ri rab nyid kyis so //
translated: “The mountains” means by Sumeru itself.

original: rnams kyis mang po'i tshig nyid ni ri rab mang po dang ldan pas mnan pa ste lcog brgyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnams kyis mang po'i tshig nyid ni ri rab mang po dang ldan pas mnan pa ste lcog brgyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The very word “many” means that it is pressed down with many Sumerus, because there are eight layers.

original: gang du gzhag ce na /
analyzed: gang du gzhag ce na /
translated: Where is it placed?

original: gsungs pa dkyil 'khor sna tshogs rdo rje'i 'og tu mnan pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa dkyil 'khor sna tshogs rdo rje'i 'og tu mnan pa'o //
translated: It is said that it is pressed down below the vajra cross of the maṇḍala.

original: don ni 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di nyid yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: 'khrul 'khor ser po ni zla ba ste de'i steng du bsgrub bya ser po /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor ser po ni zla ba ste de'i steng du bsgrub bya ser po /
translated: The yellow wheel is the moon, and on that the yellow one to be subdued.

original: de'i steng du sna tshogs rdo rje dang / de'i steng du sa dang / de'i steng du ri rab bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du sna tshogs rdo rje dang / de'i steng du sa dang / de'i steng du ri rab bsgom par bya'o //
translated: On that one should meditate on a variegated vajra, and on that the earth, and on that Mount Meru.

original: na ge ni ri bos so //
analyzed: na ge ni ri bos so //
translated: The word “naga” is Mount Meru.

original: bral ya ni khab ste de las byung ba'i ri bo rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bral ya ni khab ste de las byung ba'i ri bo rnams kyis so //
translated: “ Bhrūṃ” is a needle, and the mountains come from that.

original: mnan zhes pa ni ngos rnams nas te /
analyzed: mnan zhes pa ni ngos rnams nas te /
translated: “ Subdued” is from the sides.

original: steng nas ni ri rab nyid kyis mnan pas so //
analyzed: steng nas ni ri rab nyid kyis mnan pas so //
translated: From above, Mount Meru itself is the subduer.

original: ngag rengs par bstan pa'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: ngag rengs par bstan pa'i don gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the teaching on the paralysis of speech is stated.

original: ngag ni rengs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de bzhin zhes pa ni sngar gyi ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ngag ni rengs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de bzhin zhes pa ni sngar gyi ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: “ Speech is paralyzed” and so forth is stated. “ Just like that” is just as before.

original: de nas lha'i gzugs nyid kyang de nyid de'i khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i gzugs nyid kyang de nyid de'i khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: Then, the form of the deity itself is just that. The difference is this.

original: bsgrub bya'i lce la sna tshogs rdo rje ser po'i steng du dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i lce la sna tshogs rdo rje ser po'i steng du dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: On the tongue of the one to be subdued, on a variegated yellow vajra, is the maṇḍala of great power.

original: de'i steng du gshin rje gshed bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du gshin rje gshed bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine Yamântaka on top of that.

original: ji ltar brjod pa zhes bya ba ni zhi ba la sogs pa'o //🔽gshin rje nag po'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: ji ltar brjod pa zhes bya ba ni zhi ba la sogs pa'o // gshin rje nag po'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: As for in accordance with the statement, it refers to the pacification, etc.🔽By the application of Kṛiṣṇa Yamântaka,

original: zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed nag po'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i sbyor bas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed nag po'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i sbyor bas te /
translated: means by the application taught in the Kṛiṣṇayamântaka Tantra,

original: sang rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la gnod pa'i mi 'di dmyal bar 'gro ba las bsgral ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: sang rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la gnod pa'i mi 'di dmyal bar 'gro ba las bsgral ba'i don du'o //
translated: in order to liberate this man who harms the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha from going to hell.

original: ming bzung ste bsad pas don chen por 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i phyir dur khrod ras la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ming bzung ste bsad pas don chen por 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i phyir dur khrod ras la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to teach that by killing him after having taken his name, there will be great benefit, it says on a cloth from a charnel ground, and so on.

original: brtul zhugs can ni gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs can ni gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor ba'o //
translated: The one with observance is the one with the yoga of Yamântaka.

original: snag tsha bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ske tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: snag tsha bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ske tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to teach the ink, it says sesame, and so on.

original: 'dab ma las byung ba'i khu ba'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma las byung ba'i khu ba'o //
translated: It is the juice that comes from the leaves.

original: gtum po'i sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mdzub mo ni rang gi'o //
analyzed: gtum po'i sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mdzub mo ni rang gi'o //
translated: As for the seed of Caṇḍa, and so on, the index finger is one's own.

original: tsi tra ka'i khu bas sam zhes pa ni las zhes bya ba skra ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: tsi tra ka'i khu bas sam zhes pa ni las zhes bya ba skra ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: The juice of citraka means the hair is gathered.

original: rab tu rtogs pa'i sgro smyug ces pa ni bya rog chen po'i sgro smyug gi bri ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa'i sgro smyug ces pa ni bya rog chen po'i sgro smyug gi bri ba'o //
translated: The feather of a partridge means it is written with the feather of a great crow.

original: @273a * // sems can gnod par byed pa'i mi //
analyzed: @273a * // sems can gnod par byed pa'i mi //
translated: The name of the sentient being to be harmed

original: zhes pa ni gsad par bya ba'i sems can gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gsad par bya ba'i sems can gyi ming ngo //
translated: means the name of the sentient being to be killed.

original: lha'i rnam pa'i don du gsungs pa bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lha'i rnam pa'i don du gsungs pa bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For the purpose of the form of the deity, it is said one should draw oneself and so on.

original: sma ra smin ma de bzhin ser //
analyzed: sma ra smin ma de bzhin ser //
translated: The moustache, eyebrows, and likewise the hair are yellow.

original: zhes bya ba ni smar dang / smin ma dang / skra yang ser ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni smar dang / smin ma dang / skra yang ser ba'o //
translated: This means the moustache, eyebrows, and hair are yellow.

original: bri ste zhes bya ba ni bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bri ste zhes bya ba ni bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Drawing means one should meditate.

original: 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni dkar po'o //
translated: The wheel is white.

original: padma chen po ni dmar po'o //
analyzed: padma chen po ni dmar po'o //
translated: The great lotus is red.

original: thod pa nyid ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: thod pa nyid ni dkar po'o //
translated: The skull itself is white.

original: zla ba bzang po'i 'od ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: zla ba bzang po'i 'od ni dkar po'o //
translated: The light of the good moon is white.

original: rdo rje rgyan gyis yang dag brgyan //
analyzed: rdo rje rgyan gyis yang dag brgyan //
translated: Adorned with the ornament of the vajra

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyag rgya lnga 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyag rgya lnga 'dzin pa'o //
translated: means holding the five symbolic ornaments of the nature of the tathāgatas.

original: ba spu'i bu ga chen po nas //
analyzed: ba spu'i bu ga chen po nas //
translated: From the great pores of the skin.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi snying gar gsad pa'i mtshan ma la gnas pa'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi rnam pa ba spu'i bu ga kun nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi snying gar gsad pa'i mtshan ma la gnas pa'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer gyi rnam pa ba spu'i bu ga kun nas so //
translated: This means that from the seed located in the sign of death in one's heart, light rays radiate in the form of the pores of the skin.

original: rang rigs bdag po zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzugs 'dzin pa'i gshen rje gshed kyi tshogs dang 'dis nye bar mtshon pa las gshin rje gshed bdag nyid kyang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rang rigs bdag po zhes bya ba ni rang gi gzugs 'dzin pa'i gshen rje gshed kyi tshogs dang 'dis nye bar mtshon pa las gshin rje gshed bdag nyid kyang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The lord of one's own family means the assembly of Yamantakayas who assume one's own form. This also illustrates the understanding of Yamantaka himself.

analyzed: drag po las kyi dgongs pas bya rog gi sgro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: With the intention of a violent rite, one should draw a crow feather, etc.

original: bya rog ni bya rog chen po'o //
analyzed: bya rog ni bya rog chen po'o //
translated: The crow is a great crow.

original: smyu gus ni bsad pa dang / dbye ba dang / bskrad pa la sogs pa bri bar bya zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: smyu gus ni bsad pa dang / dbye ba dang / bskrad pa la sogs pa bri bar bya zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: One should draw the killing, the separating, the expelling, etc. with a stick. The rest is self-evident.

original: nyi ma phyed na ro bsregs sar //
analyzed: nyi ma phyed na ro bsregs sar //
translated: At noon, in a cremation ground,

original: zhes pa ni ro sreg pa'i sa'i nang du brkos te gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ro sreg pa'i sa'i nang du brkos te gzhug par bya'o //
translated: one should dig in the ground of a cremation ground and place it there.

original: padma kha sbyor zhes pa ni //
analyzed: padma kha sbyor zhes pa ni //
translated: The joined lotus is

original: kha sbyor dang padma'i kha sbyor padma ste /
analyzed: kha sbyor dang padma'i kha sbyor padma ste /
translated: the joined lotus and the joined lotus of the lotus.

original: de las bsad pa dang bskrad pa dang dbye ba'i spyod yul la ni /
analyzed: de las bsad pa dang bskrad pa dang dbye ba'i spyod yul la ni /
translated: In the case of the field of killing, separating, and expelling,

original: phru pa la sogs pa'i gyo mo kha sbyor du'o //
analyzed: phru pa la sogs pa'i gyo mo kha sbyor du'o //
translated: one should place the chaff, etc. in a joined lotus.

original: dgug pa ni padma ste bud med kyi thod pa'o //
analyzed: dgug pa ni padma ste bud med kyi thod pa'o //
translated: The lotus is the skull of a woman.

original: gshin rje'i rnal 'byor bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: gshin rje'i rnal 'byor bdag nyid kyis //
translated: The self of the yoga of Yamar

original: zhes bya ba ni de der ji skad gsungs pa'i gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de der ji skad gsungs pa'i gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs kyis so //
translated: is the form of Yamantaka as described there.

original: bzlas te zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bzlas te zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'o //
translated: The recitation is the utterance.

original: @275a * // lho phyogs gnas te zhes bya ba ni lho phyogs su mngon par phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: @275a * // lho phyogs gnas te zhes bya ba ni lho phyogs su mngon par phyogs pa ste /
translated: The dwelling in the south is facing south.

original: drag po'i las kyi dgongs pas 'dir nye bar mtshon par bya ste /
analyzed: drag po'i las kyi dgongs pas 'dir nye bar mtshon par bya ste /
translated: The intention of the fierce rite is indicated here.

original: gzhan dag dang gzhan dag gi ltos nas gzhan dang gzhan gyi don du mngon par phyogs ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag dang gzhan dag gi ltos nas gzhan dang gzhan gyi don du mngon par phyogs ba shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand facing in terms of other and other, in terms of the other's purpose.

original: las grub nas 'khrul 'khor gnas pa la dgos pa med pas ni rim pa bzhin du dbye ba'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: las grub nas 'khrul 'khor gnas pa la dgos pa med pas ni rim pa bzhin du dbye ba'i don gsungs pa /
translated: Having accomplished the rite, since there is no purpose in the remaining of the maṇḍala, the meaning of the dispersal is stated in order.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ste las grub pa dang dgongs pa nye bar grub nas gang tshe bsrung ba rig par byed pa de'i tshe 'khor lo 'dzin pa yang yi ge bzhi po de dag phyis te gzung bar bya'o zhes pa ni man ngag go //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ste las grub pa dang dgongs pa nye bar grub nas gang tshe bsrung ba rig par byed pa de'i tshe 'khor lo 'dzin pa yang yi ge bzhi po de dag phyis te gzung bar bya'o zhes pa ni man ngag go //
translated: The peace is the accomplishment of the rite and the accomplishment of the will. When one is to protect, then one should hold the wheel, that is, the four syllables, after they have been divided. This is the esoteric instruction.

original: lhag ma zhes pa ni yi ge bzhi po phyis pa las gzhan dag go //
analyzed: lhag ma zhes pa ni yi ge bzhi po phyis pa las gzhan dag go //
translated: The remainder is the other syllables besides the four.

original: ji ltar bde bar zhes pa ni ji ltar 'dod par byed pa'am gzhan par bya'o /
analyzed: ji ltar bde bar zhes pa ni ji ltar 'dod par byed pa'am gzhan par bya'o /
translated: The as one likes is the doing as one wishes, or the other way.

original: khri zhes pa ni stong phrag bcu'o //
analyzed: khri zhes pa ni stong phrag bcu'o //
translated: The ten thousand is ten thousand.

original: ye shes rdo rje zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i sems kyis te grib ma dang sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i sems kyis te grib ma dang sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam pas so //
translated: The vajra wisdom is the mind free from subject and object, in the manner of a shadow or an illusion.

original: gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: By the yoga of Yamantaka.

original: zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs kyis so //
translated: By the form of such a Yamantaka.

original: yi ge bzhi po 'di dag dbye bar bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yi ge bzhi po 'di dag dbye bar bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why should these four syllables be divided?

original: gsungs pa / 'khrul 'khor 'di zhes pas so //
analyzed: gsungs pa / 'khrul 'khor 'di zhes pas so //
translated: It is said, this machine.

original: bris nas zhes pa 'di yi ge thams cad gzhag pa na'o //
analyzed: bris nas zhes pa 'di yi ge thams cad gzhag pa na'o //
translated: Having written means having placed all the letters.

original: 'khor lo bri pa'i sngar gyi rim pa ni go rims kyis te 'khor lo sngar rim mo //
analyzed: 'khor lo bri pa'i sngar gyi rim pa ni go rims kyis te 'khor lo sngar rim mo //
translated: The previous sequence of drawing the wheel is by order, the wheel is earlier.

original: tra to aa ta ra da ni bris pa'i sgra las dbye ba'o //
analyzed: tra to aa ta ra da ni bris pa'i sgra las dbye ba'o //
translated: The division is from the word written in trāṭa aranīdana.

original: ga tri ba ni ro tsa na la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ga tri ba ni ro tsa na la sogs pa ste /
translated: Gaṭibha is lac, etc.

original: de na bri ba'o //
analyzed: de na bri ba'o //
translated: That is written there.

original: 'khrul 'khor gyi rim pa bri ba'i don ro tsan la sogs pa te gang la de ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor gyi rim pa bri ba'i don ro tsan la sogs pa te gang la de ston pa'o //
translated: The meaning of drawing the sequence of the machine is lac, etc., where that is taught.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don yongs su bcad ba can ni le'u ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don yongs su bcad ba can ni le'u ste /
translated: The chapter is that which has the meaning of the desired object.

original: ngag gi tshogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: ngag gi tshogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: It is also the collection of words.

original: le'u lnga ba'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u lnga ba'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of chapter five is complete.

original: // / phyag rgya 'tshol ba'i bsgom pa las ni dngos grub dag sgrub pa po med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: // / phyag rgya 'tshol ba'i bsgom pa las ni dngos grub dag sgrub pa po med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In the meditation on searching for the seal, it is said that without the adept, the accomplishments are attained.

original: bstod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i gsol ba gdab pas phyag 'di 'du ba'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: bstod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i gsol ba gdab pas phyag 'di 'du ba'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: This homage is said for the purpose of gathering, with a supplication preceded by praise.

original: de nas bcom 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, the Blessed One, etc.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni sngar gsungs pa'i /🔽ti mug rdo rje'i rang bzhin khyod //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni sngar gsungs pa'i / ti mug rdo rje'i rang bzhin khyod //
translated: Here, “this” refers to what was previously stated,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: “You are the nature of Vajra Delusion,” etc.

original: zhe sdang zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang bar byed pa dan rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang bar byed pa dan rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Anger” is that which causes anger, which makes clear.

original: rang rang phyag rgya zhes pa ni rang rang gi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rang rang phyag rgya zhes pa ni rang rang gi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “Each one’s seal” is each one’s Tathāgata.

original: @275b dkyil 'khor gyi ni lha kun gyi //
analyzed: @275b dkyil 'khor gyi ni lha kun gyi //
translated: “All the deities of the maṇḍala”

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po yangs pa las dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad yongs su rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po yangs pa las dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad yongs su rnyed pa'o //
translated: means that all the deities of the maṇḍala are obtained from the extensive maṇḍala lord.

original: kun gyi zhes pa ni gzhung las lhag pa ste /
analyzed: kun gyi zhes pa ni gzhung las lhag pa ste /
translated: “All” is a superlative.

original: des ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po gzung ngo //
analyzed: des ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po gzung ngo //
translated: By that, the maṇḍala lord is grasped.

original: gshin rje gshed ces pa ni le'u dang por mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lnga bshad pas so //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed ces pa ni le'u dang por mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lnga bshad pas so //
translated: “Yamāntaka” is explained in the first chapter by Akṣobhya, etc.

original: de lta bas na zhe sdang dang gti mug dang phra ma dang 'dod chags dan phrag dog dang gshin rje gshed rnams la rim pa ji lta bas mi bskyod pa dang rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhe sdang dang gti mug dang phra ma dang 'dod chags dan phrag dog dang gshin rje gshed rnams la rim pa ji lta bas mi bskyod pa dang rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang /
translated: Therefore, one should meditate on Akṣobhya, Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha,

original: don yod grub pa ram dbul bsgom par bya'o ;🔽/ tsa rtsi ka dang / phag mo dang / dbyangs can ma dang / goo r'i ma rnams kyi dbu la mi bskyod pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod grub pa rnam sa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin no //🔽thob dang dbyug pa dan padma dang ral gri gshin rje gshed rnams la ni /
analyzed: don yod grub pa ram dbul bsgom par bya'o ; / tsa rtsi ka dang / phag mo dang / dbyangs can ma dang / goo r'i ma rnams kyi dbu la mi bskyod pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod grub pa rnam sa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin no // thob dang dbyug pa dan padma dang ral gri gshin rje gshed rnams la ni /
translated: and Amoghasiddhi, respectively, in the places of anger, delusion, slander, desire, and jealousy, and of Yamāntaka.🔽One should meditate on Akṣobhya, Vairocana, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi, respectively, on the heads of Caurī, Pukkasi, Saṃgīti, and Ghasmarī.

original: mi bskyod pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod grub pa nams yis so //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod grub pa nams yis so //
translated: One should meditate on Akṣobhya, Vairocana, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi, respectively, in the places of the swords of Yamāntaka, and so on.

original: rtag tu dkyil 'khor ni 'khor lo'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: rtag tu dkyil 'khor ni 'khor lo'i lha rnams so //
translated: The maṇḍala is always the deities of the wheel.

original: bri bar bya zhes pa ni bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bri bar bya zhes pa ni bsgom par bya'o //
translated: “One should draw” means one should meditate.

original: sbyin sreg ces bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid can gyi te gsungs pa'i bdud rtsi myang ba'i cho ga'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: sbyin sreg ces bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid can gyi te gsungs pa'i bdud rtsi myang ba'i cho ga'i rigs pas so //
translated: “One should offer into the fire” means one should offer into the fire of inner nature, by the method of the rite of tasting the elixir as taught.

original: dgang zhes pa ni lha'i bdag nyid can gyi gzugs tshim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgang zhes pa ni lha'i bdag nyid can gyi gzugs tshim par byed pa'o //
translated: “One should fill” means one should satisfy the form of the deity.

original: dam tshig rnams la zhes pa ni go ku da ha na la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dam tshig rnams la zhes pa ni go ku da ha na la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: “In the commitments” means in the commitments of cow’s milk, curd, butter, and so on.

original: bsgrub par bya zhes pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa'i bdud rtsi myang ba'i cho gas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya zhes pa ni ji ltar gsungs pa'i bdud rtsi myang ba'i cho gas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: “One should practice” means one should eat by the method of tasting the elixir as taught.

original: sdom pa zhes bya ba ni nges par bya ba sti ;
analyzed: sdom pa zhes bya ba ni nges par bya ba sti ;
translated: “One should observe” means one should definitely do.

original: / de yang dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa la sogs pa can nyid do //
analyzed: / de yang dkyil 'khor bzhengs pa la sogs pa can nyid do //
translated: And that is the very one who creates the maṇḍala and so on.

original: dang po la ni dbu rgyan dbang //
analyzed: dang po la ni dbu rgyan dbang //
translated: “In the first, the crown empowerment,”

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor du zhugs nas chu'i dbang gi rjes la dbu rgyan gyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor du zhugs nas chu'i dbang gi rjes la dbu rgyan gyi dbang gis so //
translated: means that after entering the maṇḍala and after the water empowerment, there is the crown empowerment.

original: rang gi zhes pa ni rdo rje'i dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi zhes pa ni rdo rje'i dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: “One’s own” means the vajra empowerment.

original: rdo rje dril bu dang zhes pa ni dril bu'i dbang bskur ba'o ;
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu dang zhes pa ni dril bu'i dbang bskur ba'o ;
translated: The vajra and bell means the empowerment of the bell.

original: / zla ba bzang ba bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / zla ba bzang ba bzhi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The four good moons means

original: ming gi dbang dang rigs gsum gyi dam tshig dang / rdo rje slob dpon dang / rdo rje brtul zhugs dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang / lung bstan pa dang / rjes su gnang ba'i rjes la ste thabs dang shes rab kyi dbang bskur ba yang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ming gi dbang dang rigs gsum gyi dam tshig dang / rdo rje slob dpon dang / rdo rje brtul zhugs dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang / lung bstan pa dang / rjes su gnang ba'i rjes la ste thabs dang shes rab kyi dbang bskur ba yang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: after the name empowerment, the three family pledges, the vajra master, the vajra conduct, the encouragement, the prophecy, and the permission, and also the method and wisdom empowerments should be taken.

original: nag po ni rdo rje @276a * //
analyzed: nag po ni rdo rje @276a * //
translated: The black means Vajrasattva.

original: sems dpa' yis ni gshin rje gshed nag po'i rgyud las /
analyzed: sems dpa' yis ni gshin rje gshed nag po'i rgyud las /
translated: In the Black Yamari Tantra,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid la nag po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid la nag po zhes bya'o //
translated: Vajrasattva is called black.

original: dbang bskur ba'i dgongs pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i dgongs pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: To show the meaning of the empowerment conferral, it is said:

original: dbang 'di dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste tho ba zhes pa ni rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang 'di dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste tho ba zhes pa ni rnyed pa'o //
translated: By these empowerments and so on. Obtained means attained.

original: rgyal ba'i sras ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The victorious sons are the bodhisattvas.

original: bya ba byed pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba can ni gtor ma yin pas /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba can ni gtor ma yin pas /
translated: Since the oblation is the forerunner of all the performance of rites,

original: gtor ma'i cho ga bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gtor ma'i cho ga bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: the procedure of the oblation is taught.

original: de nas sngags ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: de nas sngags ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
translated: Then, the mantra, etc.

original: 'byung po kun zhes bya ba ni 'byung por gyur pa thams cad de dbang po la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'byung po kun zhes bya ba ni 'byung por gyur pa thams cad de dbang po la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: All spirits are all those who have become spirits, such as Indra, etc.

original: de yang rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyi lta stangs kyis lus rnams thal bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyi lta stangs kyis lus rnams thal bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, by the gaze of the yoga of one's deity, one should reduce their bodies to ashes.

original: rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'od zer spros pa'i bdud rtsis yang dag par reg pas yud tsam gyi rnal 'byor gyi bdag nyid dang 'dra ba'i lha'i rnam par rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'od zer spros pa'i bdud rtsis yang dag par reg pas yud tsam gyi rnal 'byor gyi bdag nyid dang 'dra ba'i lha'i rnam par rdzogs pa'o //
translated: By the nectar of light rays emitted from the seed syllable in one's heart center, they are perfectly touched, and in an instant they are complete in the form of deities, like oneself.

original: de rnams kyi gtor ma ni nye bar mchod pa'o//
analyzed: de rnams kyi gtor ma ni nye bar mchod pa'o//
translated: Their oblation is the offering.

original: lugs ni byed pa ste /
analyzed: lugs ni byed pa ste /
translated: The rite is the performance.

original: sngags brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sngags brjod pa'o //
translated: The mantra is the utterance.

original: ji ltar gsungs pa'i bdud rtsi myong ba'i rim pas bdud rtsi lnga ru bskyed la /
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa'i bdud rtsi myong ba'i rim pas bdud rtsi lnga ru bskyed la /
translated: By the process of tasting the nectar as taught, one should generate the five nectars.

original: lha rnams de dag gi lce'i 'od zer gyi sgu gus bdud rtsi de dag nye bar longs spyod do //
analyzed: lha rnams de dag gi lce'i 'od zer gyi sgu gus bdud rtsi de dag nye bar longs spyod do //
translated: The gods enjoy that nectar with the rays of light from their tongues.

original: de nas ni mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu grub pa'i rjes la sngags de nyid gsungs pa ;
analyzed: de nas ni mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu grub pa'i rjes la sngags de nyid gsungs pa ;
translated: Then, after the accomplishment of the desired result, he should recite that very mantra:

original: aom aindra ye zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: aom aindra ye zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Oṃ indrāya, etc.

original: des ni lha rnams kyi phyir lag pa g-yas pas gnas de dang de rnams su spos btul zhing lag pa g-yon pas dril bu dkrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: des ni lha rnams kyi phyir lag pa g-yas pas gnas de dang de rnams su spos btul zhing lag pa g-yon pas dril bu dkrol bar bya'o //
translated: With that, he should burn incense in those places with his right hand for the sake of the gods, and he should ring the bell with his left hand.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus:

original: g-yas dang g-yon gyi gnas dang / lte ba dang / snying ga dang / brla'i gnas dang / mgrin pa dang / kha dang / g-yas pa'i sna bug dang / rna ba g-yon pa rnams su /
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon gyi gnas dang / lte ba dang / snying ga dang / brla'i gnas dang / mgrin pa dang / kha dang / g-yas pa'i sna bug dang / rna ba g-yon pa rnams su /
translated: In the right and left places, the navel, the heart, the thigh places, the throat, the mouth, the right nostril, and the left ear.

original: mig gnyis dang mtshog ma ste thams cad kyi gnas su lan gsum gsum du dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig gnyis dang mtshog ma ste thams cad kyi gnas su lan gsum gsum du dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: In the two eyes and the forehead, in all the places, he should ring three times.

original: de nas yang lte ba dang / snying gar ci bde bar ro //
analyzed: de nas yang lte ba dang / snying gar ci bde bar ro //
translated: Then again, at the navel and the heart, as he likes.

original: yang chang 'thung ba'i dus su rang gi lha nyid tshim pa'i don du gsungs pa ;
analyzed: yang chang 'thung ba'i dus su rang gi lha nyid tshim pa'i don du gsungs pa ;
translated: Also, when drinking alcohol, it is said to be for the purpose of satisfying one's deity.

original: byas nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: byas nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having done that, and so forth.

original: gru gsum ni zur gsum lag pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gis g-yon du bskor bar bya zhes man ngag go //
analyzed: gru gsum ni zur gsum lag pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gis g-yon du bskor bar bya zhes man ngag go //
translated: The triangular is the three corners, which are to be turned to the left with the ring finger of the left hand, according to the esoteric instructions.

original: ji ltar gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gyur zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gsungs pa / bi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / bi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said with the bi, and so forth.

original: bshang gci la sogs pas bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bshang gci la sogs pas bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is with feces, urine, and so forth.

original: chu zhes pa ni byang chub @276b sems sam chang ngo //
analyzed: chu zhes pa ni byang chub @276b sems sam chang ngo //
translated: The water is the bodhicitta or the alcohol.

original: bshang ba la sogs pa med na myos byed tsam gyis bya'o zhes pa ni man ngag go //
analyzed: bshang ba la sogs pa med na myos byed tsam gyis bya'o zhes pa ni man ngag go //
translated: If there is no feces, and so forth, it is said that one should do it with just the intoxicant, according to the esoteric instructions.

original: tshim par bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: tshim par bya zhes pa ni /
translated: As for satisfying,

original: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor pa la lag pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gis tshim par byas te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor pa la lag pa g-yon pa'i srin lag gis tshim par byas te /
translated: one should satisfy the maṇḍala with those with the ring finger of the left hand.

original: aom dze sha dza ma ri ye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom dze sha dza ma ri ye sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ jeṣaja mariye svāhā.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rim pas so ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rim pas so ;
translated: and so forth, in order.

original: / kyang zhes pa ni lha rnams kyi 'khor lo ma lus bar tshim par byas pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: / kyang zhes pa ni lha rnams kyi 'khor lo ma lus bar tshim par byas pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: “Also” means after satisfying the entire retinue of gods.

original: dran par byed pa ni rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dran par byed pa ni rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: “To be remembered” means to be expressed.

original: le'u bzhi pa dang ldan pa ni 'khor lo bri ba'i mdor bstan pa tsam byas te /
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa dang ldan pa ni 'khor lo bri ba'i mdor bstan pa tsam byas te /
translated: “Endowed with the fourth chapter” means having merely indicated the summary of the drawing of the maṇḍala.

original: de nas de dag bri ba'i don du gsungs pa bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas de dag bri ba'i don du gsungs pa bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, for the sake of drawing that, it is said, “one should do” and so forth.

original: bya ba zhes pa ni 'bri ba ste /
analyzed: bya ba zhes pa ni 'bri ba ste /
translated: “One should do” means to draw.

original: ri bo na la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ri bo na la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: “On a mountain peak” and so forth.

original: dkyil 'khor rim gsum zhes bya ba ni dang po'i dkyil 'khor la dkyil 'khor gnyis pas bskor bar bya zhing gnyis pa la yang gsum pas so //🔽brgyad dang bcu gnyis bcu drug pa //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rim gsum zhes bya ba ni dang po'i dkyil 'khor la dkyil 'khor gnyis pas bskor bar bya zhing gnyis pa la yang gsum pas so // brgyad dang bcu gnyis bcu drug pa //
translated: “The maṇḍala with three tiers” means that the first maṇḍala should be surrounded by the second maṇḍala, and the second by the third.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi nang du ni re'u mig brgyad pa rnams dang / dkyil 'khor gnyis pa la bcu gnyis pa dang / dkyil 'khor gsum pa la bcu drug pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi nang du ni re'u mig brgyad pa rnams dang / dkyil 'khor gnyis pa la bcu gnyis pa dang / dkyil 'khor gsum pa la bcu drug pa rnams so //
translated: “Eight, twelve, and sixteen” means that within all the maṇḍalas there are eight squares, in the second maṇḍala there are twelve, and in the third maṇḍala there are sixteen.

original: de la dkyil 'khor gsum char la khyab pa'i dbu ma las cung zad kyi mtha' gnyis su shar nas zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor gsum char la khyab pa'i dbu ma las cung zad kyi mtha' gnyis su shar nas zhugs pa'o //
translated: The central line, which extends through all three maṇḍalas, is slightly bent at both ends.

original: nub tu ri mo gnyis drang par bya'o //
analyzed: nub tu ri mo gnyis drang par bya'o //
translated: Two lines are drawn from the west.

original: de bzhin du byang nas zhugs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang nas zhugs te /
translated: In the same way, two lines are drawn from the north.

original: ri mo gnyis drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ri mo gnyis drang bar bya'o //
translated: Two lines are drawn from the east.

original: de dag thams cad kyi nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbu ma'i re'u mig por pa dang / re'u mig brgyad du gyur to //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbu ma'i re'u mig por pa dang / re'u mig brgyad du gyur to //
translated: In the middle of all of them, the central square of the maṇḍala is divided into eight squares.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i mtshams kyi cha rnams su ri mo re re sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i mtshams kyi cha rnams su ri mo re re sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In the intermediate directions of the second maṇḍala, one line is given.

original: de dag gis ni gnyis par yang re'u mig bcu gnyis su gyur to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni gnyis par yang re'u mig bcu gnyis su gyur to //
translated: By that, the second maṇḍala also becomes twelve squares.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i mtshams su gnas pa'i ri mo'i mgo bo nas brtsams te logs gnyis nas ri mo gnyis bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i mtshams su gnas pa'i ri mo'i mgo bo nas brtsams te logs gnyis nas ri mo gnyis bri bar bya'o //
translated: Beginning from the head of the line that is located in the intermediate directions of the second maṇḍala, two lines are drawn from the two sides.

original: de lta bu sa ni zlum por bskor bar gsum pa la yang le'u tshe bcu drug tu gyur to //
analyzed: de lta bu sa ni zlum por bskor bar gsum pa la yang le'u tshe bcu drug tu gyur to //
translated: In that way, the third maṇḍala is also drawn in a circle and becomes sixteen squares.

original: dgod par bya zhes pa ni thams cad kyi nang zlum por bskor ba la'o //
analyzed: dgod par bya zhes pa ni thams cad kyi nang zlum por bskor ba la'o //
translated: “One should write” means that all of them are surrounded by a circle.

original: sngags zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga lnga'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams te dbus su ya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes kyi tshig gis so //
analyzed: sngags zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga lnga'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams te dbus su ya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes kyi tshig gis so //
translated: “The mantra” means the seed syllables of the five tathāgatas, the letter ya in the center, and so on, as indicated by the subsequent words.

original: de yang mtshams bzhi po bor te lhag ma re'u mig lnga po dag go //
analyzed: de yang mtshams bzhi po bor te lhag ma re'u mig lnga po dag go //
translated: Moreover, it is the five remaining squares, omitting the four corners.

original: re'u mig bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gnyis @277a * //🔽pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: re'u mig bcu gnyis zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gnyis @277a * // pa dag gi'o //
translated: The “twelve squares” are those of the second maṇḍala.

original: de la sgo skyong la sogs pa rnams kyi yi ge bcu gnyis pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la sgo skyong la sogs pa rnams kyi yi ge bcu gnyis pa rnams so //
translated: There, the twelve syllables of the gate keepers and so on are written.

original: sngags dgong pa'i dgongs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngags dgong pa'i dgongs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The intention of writing the mantra is stated:

original: grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽ma lus lus pa med par zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / ma lus lus pa med par zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa la ltos pa'o //
translated: “Accomplishment” and so on.🔽“Without remainder” means in terms of the mundane and supramundane.

original: rgyu dang mi rgyur bcas pa ni snod dang bcud du bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang mi rgyur bcas pa ni snod dang bcud du bcas pa'o //
translated: “With and without” means with the environment and with the inhabitants.

original: dang po dang gnyis po'i zlum por bskor ba la sa bon bskor ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bskor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: dang po dang gnyis po'i zlum por bskor ba la sa bon bskor ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bskor ba gsungs pa /
translated: The first and second are surrounded by circles, and the seed-syllable mantra is recited.

original: ya ma r'a dza zhes pa la sogs pa ste yang dgod par bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ya ma r'a dza zhes pa la sogs pa ste yang dgod par bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the verse to be recited?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / dbus su ya zhes pa ste ya yig ni thams cad kyi nang zlum por bskor ba dang po la'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / dbus su ya zhes pa ste ya yig ni thams cad kyi nang zlum por bskor ba dang po la'o //
translated: In the center is the syllable ya, the syllable ya is surrounded by circles in the first.

original: kshe zhes pa ni kshe yig go //🔽'jam pa'i rdo rje zhes ba ni ma yig go //
analyzed: kshe zhes pa ni kshe yig go // 'jam pa'i rdo rje zhes ba ni ma yig go //
translated: The syllable kṣe is the syllable kṣe.🔽Mañjuvajra is the syllable ma.

original: me zhes pa ni me yig go //
analyzed: me zhes pa ni me yig go //
translated: The syllable me is the syllable me.

original: dan da ma ni da yig go //
analyzed: dan da ma ni da yig go //
translated: The syllable da is the syllable da.

original: mtshams kyi stong ba dag ces pa ni nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams kyi bzhi bor ba rnams su'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi stong ba dag ces pa ni nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams kyi bzhi bor ba rnams su'o //
translated: The four empty spaces in the intermediate directions are the four intermediate directions of the inner maṇḍala.

original: de dag kyang ci bsgrub bya 'ba' zhig gi ming bri'am zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang ci bsgrub bya 'ba' zhig gi ming bri'am zhe na /
translated: Should only the name of the victim be written there?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / h'um zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / h'um zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The syllable hūṃ and so forth.

original: thog ma dang mthar h'um yig gnyis bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thog ma dang mthar h'um yig gnyis bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that two hūṃ syllables should be placed at the beginning and end.

original: de lta bu yang drag po'i las ltos nas brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bu yang drag po'i las ltos nas brjod pa yin la /
translated: Such is said in relation to the rite of wrath.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa la ni na ma la sogs pa'i yi ge spel bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa la ni na ma la sogs pa'i yi ge spel bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the case of the rites of pacification, etc., one should understand that the syllables na, ma, etc., are to be added.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis par bri ba'i don du ya tsa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis par bri ba'i don du ya tsa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: For the purpose of drawing in the second maṇḍala, [the Bhagavān] declares, ya, ca, etc.

original: phyi rol du zhes pa ni dang por bskor pa las phyi rol du ste /
analyzed: phyi rol du zhes pa ni dang por bskor pa las phyi rol du ste /
translated: Outside means outside the first encircling.

original: zlum por bskor ba gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zlum por bskor ba gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the second encircling circle.

original: g-yon nas brtsams te zhes bya ba ni g-yon pa ste ji ltar legs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon nas brtsams te zhes bya ba ni g-yon pa ste ji ltar legs par gyur pa'o //

original: don ni 'di yin te ji ltar tshigs su bcad pa'i 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du bri ba'o //
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te ji ltar tshigs su bcad pa'i 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du bri ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that one should draw in the same way as it will occur in the verse.

analyzed: des na sngon du kshe yig nas brtsams te g-yas nas bskor zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that one should begin from the syllable kṣe and encircle from the right.

original: rim pa gsum pa zhes bya ba ni zlum por bskor ba gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa gsum pa zhes bya ba ni zlum por bskor ba gsum pa'o //

analyzed: mdun du zhes pa ni zlum pos bskor ba gnyis pa la shar phyogs nas bskor ba ste ya yig las gzhan zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: shar nas zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs nas bskor ba dag ste le'u tsho nas brtsams te g-yas nas bskor zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: Starting from the east means the circles starting from the east, beginning from the square, the rest is clockwise.

original: dhri ti bi la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dhri ti bi la sogs pa ste /
translated: Dhriti, Vila, and so on.

original: sngags zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sngags zhes pa ni /
translated: Mantras means

original: aom hr'i: shtri: wi kri t'a na na h'um @277b zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: aom hr'i: shtri: wi kri t'a na na h'um @277b zhes pa'i don to //

original: de yi bar bar nyid dag tu /
analyzed: de yi bar bar nyid dag tu /
translated: In between those,

analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags bris pa'i bar dag tu le'u tshe la gnas pa la'o //

analyzed: gsungs pa / mo ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: rab sngags dang po na mo mthar //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rab sngags dang po dang mthar ni na ma zhes rtogs par bya'o //

original: rab sngags ni aom yig ste gang gi dang por rab sngags 'di'o //
analyzed: rab sngags ni aom yig ste gang gi dang por rab sngags 'di'o //
translated: The first mantra is the syllable om, which has this first mantra.

analyzed: bsrung zhing 'khor lo rnam par bri ba la bsrung ba ni zhi ba'o //
translated: Protecting and drawing the wheel means that protection is pacification.

original: 'di dag nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag nye bar mtshon pa ste /

analyzed: de'i don gyis na 'khor lo ste 'khrul 'khor gnyis so //

original: de'i rnam pa bri ba ni /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa bri ba ni /
translated: Drawing their forms means

original: le'u drug pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u drug pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /

translated: In order to teach the faces and so forth of the four yoginīs of the maṇḍala that were not previously mentioned, it is said:🔽Three faces, six arms,

analyzed: zhal gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so forth.

analyzed: phyag na 'khor lo zhes pa 'dis gti mug gshin rje gshed kyi phyag mtshan gyi gtso bo 'dzin pa'i phyir mtshan ma zhes gzhan dag zhal yang gti mug gshin rje gshed dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The wheel in the hand of this one is the chief sign of holding the sign of Delusion-Yamântaka, and so he is called Sign by others. His face is also like Delusion-Yamântaka.

original: dgos pa bstan pa'i don du khrag dgug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sbyor ba las shes pa'i rab tu sbyor ba'i spyod yul las so //🔽rdo rje phag gdong ma'i zhal la sogs pa'i don du zhal gsum zhes bya @278a * //
analyzed: dgos pa bstan pa'i don du khrag dgug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sbyor ba las shes pa'i rab tu sbyor ba'i spyod yul las so // rdo rje phag gdong ma'i zhal la sogs pa'i don du zhal gsum zhes bya @278a * //
translated: For the sake of teaching the purpose, summoning blood and so forth. The practice is to be understood from the practice of the field of knowledge.

original: ba la sogs pa ste mgo na zhes pa ni phag gi gdong ba can no //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa ste mgo na zhes pa ni phag gi gdong ba can no //
translated: For the sake of the meaning of the face of Vajra Sow-face and so forth, three faces and so forth. Head means the face of a pig.

original: phyag na rdo rje zhes pa 'dis rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di yang zhe sdang gshin rje gshed dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje zhes pa 'dis rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di yang zhe sdang gshin rje gshed dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The vajra in the hand of this one is the chief sign of holding the sign of Hatred-Yamântaka, and so he is like Hatred-Yamântaka in the same order.

original: dgos pa bstan pa'i don du chang dgug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa bstan pa'i don du chang dgug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For the sake of teaching the purpose, summoning beer and so forth.

original: rdo rje dbyangs can ma'i zhal la sogs pa'i don du zhal gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje dbyangs can ma'i zhal la sogs pa'i don du zhal gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: For the sake of Vajra Sarasvati, etc., he says three faces, etc.

original: padma dmar po 'dzin zhes bya ba 'dis kyang rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di 'dod chags gshin rje gshed dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: padma dmar po 'dzin zhes bya ba 'dis kyang rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di 'dod chags gshin rje gshed dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: By holding a red lotus he also shows that she is like Passion-Yamari, in the same order.

original: dgos pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: dgos pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: For the sake of showing the purpose, he says

original: shes rab 'phel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'phel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: increase of wisdom, etc.

original: rdo rje goo r'i ma'i zhal la sogs pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje goo r'i ma'i zhal la sogs pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: For the sake of showing the face, etc., of Vajra Gauri, he says

original: zhal gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽'di lta bus kyang phrag dog gshin rje gshed kyi zhal dang / sku mdog gtsor bstan pa las /
analyzed: zhal gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / 'di lta bus kyang phrag dog gshin rje gshed kyi zhal dang / sku mdog gtsor bstan pa las /
translated: three faces, etc.

original: 'di yang phrag dog gshin rje gshed dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang phrag dog gshin rje gshed dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: By this he shows that she is like Envy-Yamari, in that she has the same face and body-color as the chief deity.

original: dgos pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: dgos pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: For the sake of showing the purpose, he says

original: khu ba dgug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khu ba dgug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: summoning of semen, etc.

original: tsartsi ka'i dgos pa bstan pa bshad pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: tsartsi ka'i dgos pa bstan pa bshad pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: For the sake of showing the purpose of Cauris, he says🔽for the sake of summoning blood, etc.

original: de nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, “with the vajra” and so forth.

original: khrag dgug ces pa ni gang gis khrag 'gug par byed pa de lta bu'o //
analyzed: khrag dgug ces pa ni gang gis khrag 'gug par byed pa de lta bu'o //
translated: “Blood summoning” means that by which one summons blood, such is the case.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje ste mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje ste mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the vajra, because it is indivisible.

original: de yang rdo rje tsa rtsi ka'i gzugs te der sems gcig pas na de nyid ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje tsa rtsi ka'i gzugs te der sems gcig pas na de nyid ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: That is also the form of Vajravetālī, and one-pointed mind is that very samādhi.

original: kha gdangs pa dag byas pa ni //
analyzed: kha gdangs pa dag byas pa ni //
translated: “Having made the mouth open”

original: zhes bya ba ni lce la dza: yig dmar po bltas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lce la dza: yig dmar po bltas te /
translated: means that one visualizes the syllable JRA in the tongue, red in color.

original: de'i 'od zer rnams las srin bu padma'i rnam par song ste /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer rnams las srin bu padma'i rnam par song ste /
translated: From those light rays, insects go in the form of lotuses.

original: bsgrub bya'i snying phug ste de'i khrag rnams srin bu padma'i rnam pa des bkug nas rang gi khar zhugs par nga rgyal brtan bar bya zhing sngags brjod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i snying phug ste de'i khrag rnams srin bu padma'i rnam pa des bkug nas rang gi khar zhugs par nga rgyal brtan bar bya zhing sngags brjod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Having pierced the heart of the victim, those light rays in the form of lotuses summon the blood of the victim and enter one’s own mouth. One should stabilize one’s pride and recite the mantra.

original: khams gsum ni 'jig rten gsum pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum ni 'jig rten gsum pa'o //
translated: The three realms are the three worlds.

original: khrag chen po ni khrag gi tshogs so //
analyzed: khrag chen po ni khrag gi tshogs so //
translated: Great blood is a collection of blood.

original: chang 'gug pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin pa'i rdo rje phag mo'i gzugs te /
analyzed: chang 'gug pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin pa'i rdo rje phag mo'i gzugs te /
translated: The one called “vajra of the summoned beer” is the form of Vajravarahi as before.

original: 'dir gsungs zhes bya ba ni gsungs nas so //
analyzed: 'dir gsungs zhes bya ba ni gsungs nas so //
translated: “Here” means “having spoken.”

original: chang gzhag pa'i snod gsungs pa /🔽rdza mkhan lag pa phyis pa'i sa //
analyzed: chang gzhag pa'i snod gsungs pa / rdza mkhan lag pa phyis pa'i sa //
translated: The vessel for placing the beer is stated:🔽“The one washed by the potter’s hand.”

original: zhes pa ste kham pa'i snod byas pa'i rjes la lag pa phyis pa byas te gang 'jim pa rdza mkhan gyis bor ba de las so //
analyzed: zhes pa ste kham pa'i snod byas pa'i rjes la lag pa phyis pa byas te gang 'jim pa rdza mkhan gyis bor ba de las so //
translated: After making a vessel of clay, having washed the hand, whatever clay the potter has discarded, from that.

original: nye bar byas la zhes pa ni ring thung gi tshad khru gang la kha'i zheng du mtho gang ba lto che ba der chang blugs la snod chung ba gzhan zhig dang ldan pas kha @278b bcad pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar byas la zhes pa ni ring thung gi tshad khru gang la kha'i zheng du mtho gang ba lto che ba der chang blugs la snod chung ba gzhan zhig dang ldan pas kha @278b bcad pa'o //
translated: “Having prepared” means that the measure of length is one cubit, the width of the mouth is one handspan, the belly is large, the beer is poured into that, and it is covered with another small vessel.

original: rkun ma'i skra'i steng zhes pa ni g-yengs pa'i skra las chun po bya ste /
analyzed: rkun ma'i skra'i steng zhes pa ni g-yengs pa'i skra las chun po bya ste /
translated: “On top of the hair of the thief” means that a bundle is made from the hair of a thief.

original: sngags 'dis rjes su drang bar bya //
analyzed: sngags 'dis rjes su drang bar bya //
translated: “With this mantra, one should summon.”

original: zhes bya ba ni chang cung zad myos nas 'ongs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chang cung zad myos nas 'ongs te /
translated: This means that having become slightly intoxicated with beer,

original: snod du blugs nas chang de la dza: yig dmar po'i 'od zer gyi sbu gus sbu bas nas drangs te zhugs nas snod du blugs pa nyid du bsam zhing sngags brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: snod du blugs nas chang de la dza: yig dmar po'i 'od zer gyi sbu gus sbu bas nas drangs te zhugs nas snod du blugs pa nyid du bsam zhing sngags brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having poured it into a vessel, one should recite the mantra, imagining that the beer is drawn up by the tube of the red JRAM syllable light-rays.

original: pa ta na'i mchod rten dag tu bstan pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: pa ta na'i mchod rten dag tu bstan pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The teaching in the Patalia stupas is as follows.

original: aom ta de sha zhes bya ba'i gnas na pa ta na'i mchod rten yod pa ste /
analyzed: aom ta de sha zhes bya ba'i gnas na pa ta na'i mchod rten yod pa ste /
translated: In the place called Om Tadesha there is a Patalia stupa.

original: der dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dkyil 'khor du bcom ldan 'das de dag nyid kyi cho gas 'jig rten gsum gyi chang 'gugs pa'o //
analyzed: der dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dkyil 'khor du bcom ldan 'das de dag nyid kyi cho gas 'jig rten gsum gyi chang 'gugs pa'o //
translated: There, in the mandala of heroes and heroines, one should summon the beer of the three worlds by the rite of those very Blessed Ones.

original: de ltar yang rdo rje phag mo'i khyim de nyid na chang gi dri zad pa med pa yod do //
analyzed: de ltar yang rdo rje phag mo'i khyim de nyid na chang gi dri zad pa med pa yod do //
translated: Thus, in that very house of Vajravarahi, there is an inexhaustible supply of beer.

original: dal gyis dmigs nas 'bad par bya //🔽zhes pa ni pha rol gyi spyod yul ma yin te mi smra bas so //
analyzed: dal gyis dmigs nas 'bad par bya // zhes pa ni pha rol gyi spyod yul ma yin te mi smra bas so //
translated: Having visualized the mandala, one should make an effort.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: The vajra perfection of wisdom is the thorough differentiation.

original: gzung pa dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa'i ye shes ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: gzung pa dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa'i ye shes ni shes rab bo //
translated: The wisdom that is devoid of the things of subject and object is wisdom.

original: de'i phyi rol na chos thams cad bdag med pa'i gnyis su med par shes pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol na chos thams cad bdag med pa'i gnyis su med par shes pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Beyond that, it is the characteristic of the knowledge of the nonduality of the selflessness of all phenomena.

original: phyin pa ni blo ste des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: phyin pa ni blo ste des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The “perfection” is the mind, and so it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nyid mi phyed pas na rdo rje ste dbyangs can ma'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de nyid mi phyed pas na rdo rje ste dbyangs can ma'i gzugs so //
translated: It is a “vajra” because it is indivisible, and it is Sarasvatī’s form.

original: ting nge 'dzin zhes pa ni sngar gyi bzhin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin zhes pa ni sngar gyi bzhin no //
translated: “Samādhi” is as before.

original: gzugs 'dis kyang brtsams pa la zhugs te zhag so sor bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'dis kyang brtsams pa la zhugs te zhag so sor bzla bar bya'o //
translated: One should begin the composition with this form, and recite it daily.

original: aom r'a ga ra ti zhes pa'i sngags ni sngar gyi bsnyen pa'i yi ge 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: aom r'a ga ra ti zhes pa'i sngags ni sngar gyi bsnyen pa'i yi ge 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: The mantra “oṃ rāgārati” is the previously mentioned mantra, and one should recite it one hundred thousand times.

original: rdo rje dbyangs can ma'i gzugs nyid kyi thams cad la bya'o zhes pa ni man ngag go //🔽tshes kyi dang po nas bzung ste //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyangs can ma'i gzugs nyid kyi thams cad la bya'o zhes pa ni man ngag go // tshes kyi dang po nas bzung ste //
translated: It is an instruction that one should do everything with the form of Vajra Sarasvatī.🔽“Starting from the first day of the lunar month”

original: zhes pa ni dkar po'i tshes nas bzung ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkar po'i tshes nas bzung ste /
translated: means starting from the first day of the bright fortnight.

original: dus nam gyi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: dus nam gyi tshe zhe na /
translated: At what time, one might ask?

original: gsungs pa / ji srid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste gang cung zad brjod pa kun te yang dag par 'dus byas pa de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gsungs pa / ji srid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste gang cung zad brjod pa kun te yang dag par 'dus byas pa de nyid kyis so //
translated: It is said, “As long as…” and so forth. Whatever is expressed is all completely assembled, just by that.

original: de nyid kyi phyogs la yang ci nyin zhag de nyid la yang dag par 'dus pa de nyid dam zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyogs la yang ci nyin zhag de nyid la yang dag par 'dus pa de nyid dam zhe na /
translated: In that very direction, is that very assembly on that very day?

original: gsungs pa / ji srid zla ba'i rjes su 'jug pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / ji srid zla ba'i rjes su 'jug pa zhes pa ste /
translated: It is said, “As long as following the moon…”

original: gang gi tshe zla ba shar ba dang der mngon par phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zla ba shar ba dang der mngon par phyogs pa'o //
translated: When the moon rises, it is directed there.

original: mi nus na mdun du snod chus bkang la zla ba'i gzugs la blta zhes pa ni man ngag go //
analyzed: mi nus na mdun du snod chus bkang la zla ba'i gzugs la blta zhes pa ni man ngag go //
translated: If one is unable, one should fill a vessel with water in front of oneself and look at the form of the moon. This is the instruction.

original: ma lus lus pa med pa ni //
analyzed: ma lus lus pa med pa ni //
translated: “Without exception”

original: zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //🔽khams @279a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o // khams @279a * //
translated: means both mundane and supramundane.🔽The three realms

original: gsum ma lus pa zhes pa ni 'jig rten gsum po kun kyang dbang du gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsum ma lus pa zhes pa ni 'jig rten gsum po kun kyang dbang du gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that all three worlds are brought under control.

original: khu ba 'gug pa la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: khu ba 'gug pa la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The summoning of the semen and so forth is as before.🔽The form of Vajragauri

original: rdo rje goo r'i'i gzugs la zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje goo r'i'i gzugs la zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means the form of Vajragauri.

original: rlung dang dril bu lcags kyu sbyor //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rlung dang dril bu lcags kyu sbyor // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The wind, the bell, and the hook are applied.

original: aom ka ta ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags brjod pa ste /
analyzed: aom ka ta ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags brjod pa ste /
translated: This is the recitation of the mantra Oṃ kata-

original: gang gi tshe dza: yig gsum brjod par byas pa de'i tshe lce la dza: yig dmar po'i 'od zer dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba'i rlung lcags kyu'i rnam pas nang du spu gu'i rnam pas khu ba bkug ste khar zhugs pas blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dza: yig gsum brjod par byas pa de'i tshe lce la dza: yig dmar po'i 'od zer dang bcas pa'i 'byung ba'i rlung lcags kyu'i rnam pas nang du spu gu'i rnam pas khu ba bkug ste khar zhugs pas blta bar bya'o //
translated: When one utters the three syllables jaḥ, then one should see the wind of the elements in the form of a hook, with the light rays of the red syllable jaḥ on the tongue, sucking up the semen in the form of a straw, and entering the mouth.

original: de'i tshe gang nas 'ong zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang nas 'ong zhe na /
translated: At that time, from where does it come?

original: sngar gyi dang sbyar bar bya ste kha gdong zhes pa ni bha ga'i lam nas so /
analyzed: sngar gyi dang sbyar bar bya ste kha gdong zhes pa ni bha ga'i lam nas so /
translated: It should be applied to the previous, and “mouth and face” means from the path of the bhaga.

original: rdo rje'i lam nas zhes pa ni pho'i dbang po'i bug pa nas so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i lam nas zhes pa ni pho'i dbang po'i bug pa nas so //
translated: “From the path of the vajra” means from the opening of the male organ.

original: don ni 'di yin te lam de nas rlung dang dril bu lcags kyu'i sbyor ba 'di rab tu zhugs te mgo bo na gnas pa'i khu ba'i tshogs ham yig las bkug cing drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te lam de nas rlung dang dril bu lcags kyu'i sbyor ba 'di rab tu zhugs te mgo bo na gnas pa'i khu ba'i tshogs ham yig las bkug cing drang bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning is that this wind, the bell, and the hook are applied in that path, and the collection of semen that resides in the head is sucked up and drawn by the syllable haṃ.

original: bzlas dang bsgom pa zhes pa ni sngags bzlas pa dang lhar bsgom pa'i sbyor ba las so //
analyzed: bzlas dang bsgom pa zhes pa ni sngags bzlas pa dang lhar bsgom pa'i sbyor ba las so //
translated: The recitation and meditation are from the application of reciting the mantra and meditating on the deity.

original: gshin rje 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa ste zhes sdang gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: gshin rje 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa ste zhes sdang gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs so //
translated: The conqueror of Yama is the affliction, and the form of Yamântaka is the hatred.

original: dbang bskur ba'i mchog ces pa ni sems can rjes su bzung ba la phul du gyur bas na mchog go ;
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i mchog ces pa ni sems can rjes su bzung ba la phul du gyur bas na mchog go ;
translated: The supreme consecration is the supreme consecration because it is the best for taking care of sentient beings.

original: / dbang bskur ba ni dbang gi rgyur gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / dbang bskur ba ni dbang gi rgyur gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The consecration is the cause of consecration.

original: de'i dam tshig sngags re des na dbang bskur ba mchog gi dam tshig go //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig sngags re des na dbang bskur ba mchog gi dam tshig go //
translated: The pledge is the pledge of the supreme consecration.

original: dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i don du me tog sbyin pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i don du me tog sbyin pa'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra is the mantra for giving flowers for the purpose of entering the maṇḍala.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: slob ma la mig ras bkab la dkyil 'khor khang ba'i phyi rol du yol ba phug ste /
analyzed: slob ma la mig ras bkab la dkyil 'khor khang ba'i phyi rol du yol ba phug ste /
translated: The disciple, with eyes covered, should be taken outside the maṇḍala house and placed behind a curtain.

original: au dumw'a ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi tshig 'dis lag par me tog sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: au dumw'a ra zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi tshig 'dis lag par me tog sbyin par bya'o //
translated: With the mantra words udumbara and so forth, flowers should be given into the hand.

original: me tog dor ba'i rjes la /
analyzed: me tog dor ba'i rjes la /
translated: After the flower has been cast,

original: chu dang dbu rgyan gyi dbang sbyin pa dang / gang gi tshe rdo rjes dbang bskur ba de'i tshe khams gsum chen po'i la sogs pa'i sngags 'dis sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: chu dang dbu rgyan gyi dbang sbyin pa dang / gang gi tshe rdo rjes dbang bskur ba de'i tshe khams gsum chen po'i la sogs pa'i sngags 'dis sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The bestowal of the water and crown initiations, and when the vajra initiation is bestowed, then it is with this mantra of the great realm of the three realms, and so on.

original: rdo rje dril bu'i dbang bskur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu'i dbang bskur ba gsungs pa /
translated: The bestowal of the vajra and bell initiations is stated:

original: shes rab thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Wisdom and means,” and so on.

original: rdo rje khyod kyis bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo ni khyod do zhes dbugs dbyung ba sbyin par bya'o //🔽slob ma bsdu ba nyid du gyis //
analyzed: rdo rje khyod kyis bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo ni khyod do zhes dbugs dbyung ba sbyin par bya'o // slob ma bsdu ba nyid du gyis //
translated: “You are the vajra,” and so on, is the bestowal of encouragement.

original: zhes bya ba ni rjes su gnang ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rjes su gnang ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: “You should gather disciples,” and so on, is the bestowal of permission.

original: thabs dang shes @279b rab las byung ba'i byang chub sems bza' ba'i sngags gsungs pa /
analyzed: thabs dang shes @279b rab las byung ba'i byang chub sems bza' ba'i sngags gsungs pa /
translated: The mantra for eating the bodhicitta arisen from wisdom and means is stated:

original: btung ba rin po che 'dis ni //
analyzed: btung ba rin po che 'dis ni //
translated: “With this jewel drink,

original: rdo rje'i lus ni rab grub pa //
analyzed: rdo rje'i lus ni rab grub pa //
translated: the vajra body is well accomplished.”
