analyzed: me tog dang spos dang byug pa la sogs pas kyang mchod pa byas la de gan rkyal du byas la de'i steng du bsngags te de ru bzlas pa zhes pa'o //
translated: and one should worship it with flowers, incense, ointments, etc. One should lie down on it, and one should recite the mantra over it. This is called “reciting over it.”

original: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um /🔽kve yi dags bdag gis mngon par @284a * //
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um / kve yi dags bdag gis mngon par @284a * //
translated: Oṃ hṛiḥ śṛiḥ vikṛtānana hūṃ hūṃ

original: 'dod pa'i dngos grub stsol cig h'um /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos grub stsol cig h'um /
translated: Hey ghost, grant me the power I desire. Hūṃ.

original: brtul zhugs can zhes pa ni dpal gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: brtul zhugs can zhes pa ni dpal gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas so //
translated: “The practitioner” means one who is endowed with the yoga of glorious Yamāri.

original: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma bstan pa'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: dngos grub kyi mtshan ma bstan pa'i don gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the teaching on the signs of power is stated:

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Amazing! and so forth.

original: 'o 'dod 'bod pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i sgra'o //
analyzed: 'o 'dod 'bod pa ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i sgra'o //
translated: The exclamation Oh! is a sound of amazement.

original: 'jigs pa med pa las cir 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa las cir 'gyur ba gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the statement about what happens from being fearless is stated:

original: gang dang gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Whatever and however, and so forth.

original: gang bslangs pa zhes pa de ni sems kyis byed pa ste ral gri dang mig sman dang rkang mgyogs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang bslangs pa zhes pa de ni sems kyis byed pa ste ral gri dang mig sman dang rkang mgyogs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Whatever is requested, that is done by the mind, such as a sword, eye medicine, fleet foot, and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das mgon po dpal gshin rje gshed po'i gzugs kyi don dang 'jim pa las 'dus bya bar bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mgon po dpal gshin rje gshed po'i gzugs kyi don dang 'jim pa las 'dus bya bar bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: The Bhagavān, the Lord, the glorious Yamāri, teaches the meaning of the form and the clay to be assembled:

original: ma he'i sha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma he'i sha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The flesh of a buffalo, and so forth.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi don du 'jim pa bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi don du 'jim pa bya ba'o //
translated: The form is the clay for the purpose of the form.

original: che ge mo de dag la stsol zhes bya ba ni de'i pha dang de'i ming dag rab tu spel te /
analyzed: che ge mo de dag la stsol zhes bya ba ni de'i pha dang de'i ming dag rab tu spel te /
translated: Give to so-and-so is the promotion of his father and his name.

original: de nas aom hr'i:shtr'i:wi kri t'a nan h'um h'um /
analyzed: de nas aom hr'i:shtr'i:wi kri t'a nan h'um h'um /
translated: Then, Oṃ hrīḥ ṣṭṛīḥ vikṛtānan hūṃ hūṃ.

original: che ge mos bdag la stsol cig h'um /
analyzed: che ge mos bdag la stsol cig h'um /
translated: So-and-so, give me!

original: de ltar stong phrag bcu bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar stong phrag bcu bzlas par bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should repeat [the mantra] ten thousand times.

original: de bslangs pas de ster ro //
analyzed: de bslangs pas de ster ro //
translated: If one requests in that way, then he will give.

original: mi ster par gyur na de sdug bsngal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: mi ster par gyur na de sdug bsngal bar gsungs pa /
translated: If he does not give, then he will suffer, it is said.

original: gshin rje gshed po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The one called Yamântaka and so forth.

original: sngar ma gsungs pa'i tho ba gshin rje gshed la sogs pa sgo skyong bzhi'i zhal la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sngar ma gsungs pa'i tho ba gshin rje gshed la sogs pa sgo skyong bzhi'i zhal la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The four door-guardians, such as the hammer Yamântaka, who were not previously mentioned, are described as having faces and so forth.

original: zhal gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa bya ste /
analyzed: zhal gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa bya ste /
translated: One should say, three faces and so forth.

original: thams cad kyang zhe sdang gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs la /🔽khyad par ni rdo rje'i gnas su tho ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang zhe sdang gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs la / khyad par ni rdo rje'i gnas su tho ba'o //
translated: All of them have the form of Hatred Yamântaka.🔽The difference is that the hammer is in the place of the vajra.

original: de ltar gti mug gshin rje gshed dang 'dra ba ni dbyig pa gshin rje gshed de khyad par ni 'khor lo'i gnas su rdo rje'i dbyug pa'o ;
analyzed: de ltar gti mug gshin rje gshed dang 'dra ba ni dbyig pa gshin rje gshed de khyad par ni 'khor lo'i gnas su rdo rje'i dbyug pa'o ;
translated: Thus, the one who is like Delusion Yamântaka is the club Yamântaka. The difference is that the vajra club is in the place of the wheel.

original: / de ltar padma dang ral gri gshin rje gshed kyang 'dod chags dang / phrag dog gshin rje gshed thams cad kyi bdag nyid dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: / de ltar padma dang ral gri gshin rje gshed kyang 'dod chags dang / phrag dog gshin rje gshed thams cad kyi bdag nyid dang 'dra'o //
translated: In the same way, Padma and Kartarīka are like the lords of desire and envy.

original: ji ltar sngar gyi rim pas mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga'i rjes la /
analyzed: ji ltar sngar gyi rim pas mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga'i rjes la /
translated: Just as before, after the fivefold manifest enlightenment,

original: lha bsgom pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: lha bsgom pa gsungs pa /
translated: the meditation on the deity is taught:

original: bha ga ra ling+ga rnam par bsgoms //🔽zhes pa la /
analyzed: bha ga ra ling+ga rnam par bsgoms // zhes pa la /
translated: “Meditate on the bhaga and liṅga.”

original: bha ga ra ling+ga ni phul du gyur pa'i rnal 'byor las sa bon gyi yi ge rnam par bsgom pas skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bha ga ra ling+ga ni phul du gyur pa'i rnal 'byor las sa bon gyi yi ge rnam par bsgom pas skyes pa'o //
translated: The bhaga and liṅga are generated by meditating on the seed syllables in the bhaga and liṅga of the supreme yoga.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: rang dang 'dra ba la snyoms par 'jug pa rdo rje sems dpa' gshin rje gshed kyi kha ru snying ga'i 'od zer gyis sangs rgyas thams cad bkug ste bcug @284b pas zhu bar bya ste /
analyzed: rang dang 'dra ba la snyoms par 'jug pa rdo rje sems dpa' gshin rje gshed kyi kha ru snying ga'i 'od zer gyis sangs rgyas thams cad bkug ste bcug @284b pas zhu bar bya ste /
translated: One should enter into union with oneself as the deity, and all buddhas are summoned by the light rays of the heart and dissolved into the mouth of Yamāntaka Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje'i lam nas lha mo'i padma'i nang du ltung ba'i aa yig por ba kshe ma med pa la sogs pa sa bon bcu drug po rnams yang dag par spros te gnas ji ltar bkod pa las dkyil 'khor bdag po rnams bsgom zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i lam nas lha mo'i padma'i nang du ltung ba'i aa yig por ba kshe ma med pa la sogs pa sa bon bcu drug po rnams yang dag par spros te gnas ji ltar bkod pa las dkyil 'khor bdag po rnams bsgom zhes pa'o //
translated: The sixteen seed syllables, A, etc., melted by the fire of passion, fall from the vajra path into the lotus of the goddess, and are fully emitted, and the lords of the maṇḍala are meditated upon in their respective places.

original: chags pa dang rjes su chags pa shes rab dang bcas bzhu bar bya ste /
analyzed: chags pa dang rjes su chags pa shes rab dang bcas bzhu bar bya ste /
translated: Passion and subsequent passion, together with wisdom, should be melted.

original: yam gi yi ge yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: yam gi yi ge yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The syllable YAṂ is fully perfected.

original: de nas rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis yang dag par bskul bar gyur pa dang dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po zhe sdang chen po gshin rje gshed rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis yang dag par bskul bar gyur pa dang dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po zhe sdang chen po gshin rje gshed rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, when the yoginīs fully impel him, the lord of the maṇḍala, great hatred Yamāntaka, is perfected.

original: zhe sdang rjes dran zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gshin rje gshed rdzogs par gyur nas so //
analyzed: zhe sdang rjes dran zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gshin rje gshed rdzogs par gyur nas so //
translated: “Recalling hatred” means that, having become perfected as hatred Yamāntaka,

original: gti mug gshin rje gshed bsgom par bya zhes pa ni sa bon kshe yig la skyes pa'i gti mug gshin rje gshed bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gti mug gshin rje gshed bsgom par bya zhes pa ni sa bon kshe yig la skyes pa'i gti mug gshin rje gshed bsgom par bya'o //
translated: he should meditate on delusion Yamāntaka, that is, he should meditate on delusion Yamāntaka born from the seed syllable KṢE.

original: de ltar gong nas gong nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gong nas gong nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should realize [the mandala] more and more.

original: lha'i 'khor lo rdzogs nas spro bar bstan pa'i don du spro bar bya zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i 'khor lo rdzogs nas spro bar bstan pa'i don du spro bar bya zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to teach the completion of the divine wheel and the emanation, [the Bhagavān] declares, “emanate,” and so forth.

original: rigs kyi sprin zhes pa ni rang dang 'dra ba'i lha'i tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: rigs kyi sprin zhes pa ni rang dang 'dra ba'i lha'i tshogs rnams so //
translated: The “family cloud” is the assembly of gods similar to oneself.

original: so so zhes pa ni so so dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: so so zhes pa ni so so dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “ Individually” means endowed with each [god].

original: khro bo bzhi zhes pa ni tho ba la sogs pa bzhi po rnams so //
analyzed: khro bo bzhi zhes pa ni tho ba la sogs pa bzhi po rnams so //
translated: The “four wrathful ones” are the four beginning with the hammer.

original: gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The “clear maṇḍala” is the maṇḍala of the moon.

original: le'u bcu pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u bcu pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the tenth chapter is finished.

original: // / zhe sdang la sogs pa'i dbye ba'i dgos pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / zhe sdang la sogs pa'i dbye ba'i dgos pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach the purpose of the division of hatred and so forth, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Hatred, and so forth,” and so forth.

original: zhe sdang gis mnan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gis mnan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “ Hatred, and so forth” means hatred, and so forth.

original: gshin rje gshed po ni zhe sdang gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed po ni zhe sdang gshin rje gshed do //
translated: “ Yamāntaka” is Hatred Yamāntaka.

original: dam pa'i gzugs ni grib ma dang sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i gzugs ni grib ma dang sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: “ The excellent form” is like a shadow and an illusion.

original: de bzhin gti mug gis mnan zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang 'dis rtogs par bya'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin gti mug gis mnan zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang 'dis rtogs par bya'o ;
translated: “ Likewise, delusion, and so forth,” and so forth, should be understood in the same way.

original: / sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyang blos dbyer mi phyed par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: / sna tshogs pa'i gzugs kyang blos dbyer mi phyed par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Also, in order to make the various forms inseparable from the mind, it is said:

original: bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “One should visualize oneself” and so forth.

original: bdag nyid dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor pa la sogs pa thams cad du lhag par mos par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor pa la sogs pa thams cad du lhag par mos par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize oneself as the entire maṇḍala, the maṇḍala residents, and so forth.

original: thams cad kyang bdag nyid las dbyer mi phyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad kyang bdag nyid las dbyer mi phyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that everything is inseparable from oneself.

original: rnal 'byor snying ga'i sa bon spro //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor snying ga'i sa bon spro // zhes pa ni /
translated: The yoga is the seed in the heart.

original: ba spu'i khung bu'i rtse nas spro //
analyzed: ba spu'i khung bu'i rtse nas spro //
translated: It is emitted from the tip of the pores.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar ji ltar gsungs pa de'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar ji ltar gsungs pa de'o //
translated: This is as previously stated.

original: de ltar byas pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar byas pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens by doing this?

original: dngos grub ces pa ste grub pa'i mtshan ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: dngos grub ces pa ste grub pa'i mtshan ma mthong ba'o //
translated: “Accomplishment” is seeing the signs of accomplishment.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽spyod pa ni dgu @285a * //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / spyod pa ni dgu @285a * //
translated: Then, and so forth.

original: ba ste bya ba'i khyad par te de'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ba ste bya ba'i khyad par te de'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Conduct is the ninth, a special activity, its characteristic.

original: ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?

original: gsungs pa / gshin rje gshed po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / gshin rje gshed po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said: “Yamāri” and so forth.

original: sku gsung thugs su grub ces pa ni gshin rje gshed por gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs su grub ces pa ni gshin rje gshed por gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase accomplished as body, speech, and mind means become Yamântaka.

original: spyod pa de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: spyod pa de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He states that very conduct:

original: mgon po chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mgon po chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The great lord, etc.

original: gang gi tshe 'dis cho ga de lta bus nus pa dang ldan par byas pa de'i tshe gshin rje gshed kyi dngos grub thob pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dis cho ga de lta bus nus pa dang ldan par byas pa de'i tshe gshin rje gshed kyi dngos grub thob pa'o //
translated: When he has been empowered by this rite, then he attains the power of Yamântaka.

original: de yang gang gi dus su bya bar nus she na /
analyzed: de yang gang gi dus su bya bar nus she na /
translated: And when is he able to do this?

original: gsungs pa / nus pa cung zad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / nus pa cung zad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: He says a little power, etc.

original: skyes pa ni mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa ni mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: Born means manifested.

original: brgya lam na bsgom pa tsam gyi ji lta ba ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: brgya lam na bsgom pa tsam gyi ji lta ba ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is not just meditation that occurs once in a hundred years.

original: drug las skyes zhes pa ni drug las skyes pa dang 'dra bas na drug las skyes te ro du ma dang ldan pa sna tshogs kyis chags pa dang rjes su chags par gyur pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: drug las skyes zhes pa ni drug las skyes pa dang 'dra bas na drug las skyes te ro du ma dang ldan pa sna tshogs kyis chags pa dang rjes su chags par gyur pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase born from the six means that because it is like that which is born from the six, it is born from the six. The meaning is that it is attached to and lusts after the variety of the many tastes.

original: nus pa gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i don du rgyal mtshan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nus pa gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i don du rgyal mtshan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The other powers are taught by banner, etc.

original: rgyal mtshan khyams ni dpyangs pa'i mi'o //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan khyams ni dpyangs pa'i mi'o //
translated: The banner is the man suspended in the courtyard.

original: 'o ma zhes pa ni sha ste snod la gnas pa'o //🔽bdud rtsi myang ba la bsgom pa'i rim pas mngon du zhu bar bsgrub par byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'o ma zhes pa ni sha ste snod la gnas pa'o // bdud rtsi myang ba la bsgom pa'i rim pas mngon du zhu bar bsgrub par byas pa'o //
translated: The milk is the meat, which is in the vessel.🔽The nectar is the semen, which is in the skull-bowl.🔽The rite is the rite of the nectar, which is to be accomplished by the process of meditation on the tasting of the nectar.

original: cho ga ma goms par zhes pa ni bdud rtsi'i cho ga de bzhin du goms par byas pas so //🔽phag mo'i gzugs su bya zhes pas ni /
analyzed: cho ga ma goms par zhes pa ni bdud rtsi'i cho ga de bzhin du goms par byas pas so // phag mo'i gzugs su bya zhes pas ni /
translated: The non-habituation is the habituation to the rite of the nectar.🔽The sow's form is the form of the sow as described.

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i phag mo'i gzugs su lhag par mos te rang nyid gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs su bsgom par bya zhes pa'i don to //🔽de'i rjes la mdor bsdus pa'i gshin rje gshed kyi sgrub pa'i thabs 'bras bu dang bcas pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i phag mo'i gzugs su lhag par mos te rang nyid gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs su bsgom par bya zhes pa'i don to // de'i rjes la mdor bsdus pa'i gshin rje gshed kyi sgrub pa'i thabs 'bras bu dang bcas pa bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning is that one should imagine oneself in the form of the sow, and meditate on oneself in the form of Yamântaka.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: After that, in order to teach the concise sādhana of Yamântaka together with its result, he says: Then, etc.

original: 'dir yang mchod pa la sogs pa dag /
analyzed: 'dir yang mchod pa la sogs pa dag /
translated: Here also, the worship and so forth are the same as before.

original: rdo re gur gyi nang du son pa'i nam mkhar gnas pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i bar du thams cad mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rdo re gur gyi nang du son pa'i nam mkhar gnas pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i bar du thams cad mthun pa'o //
translated: In the interior of the vajra tent, in the space between the vajra cross and the sky, all is the same.

original: sa bon ci la 'byung bar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon ci la 'byung bar bsgom zhe na /
translated: What seed is one to visualize?🔽It is stated:

original: gsungs pa / yi ge sti zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / yi ge sti zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The syllable STHI, etc.

original: 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning here is this:

original: sna tshogs rdo rje'i nang du re pha las nyi ma dang / de'i steng du sti yig las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje'i nang du re pha las nyi ma dang / de'i steng du sti yig las skyes pa'o //
translated: In the interior of the vajra cross, from the syllable RE arises the sun, and upon that, from the syllable STHI, he arises.

original: ji ltar 'byung zhe na /🔽gsungs pa / rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung zhe na / gsungs pa / rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa //
translated: How does he arise?🔽It is stated:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Dwelling in the vajra mandala, etc.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this:

original: @285b ma he'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: @285b ma he'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'o //
translated: He dwells in the sun mandala upon the bull.

original: mtshon cha bstan pa'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: mtshon cha bstan pa'i don gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the statement of the weapons is stated:

original: gang yang cung zad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang cung zad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Whatever, etc.

original: phyag rnams kyis zhes pa ni phyag rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: phyag rnams kyis zhes pa ni phyag rnams kyi'o //
translated: The hands means of the hands.

original: dbyig pa gshin rje gshed kyi yang phal cher ni phyag brgya pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyig pa gshin rje gshed kyi yang phal cher ni phyag brgya pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs nyid bzhin no //
translated: The staff Yama is mostly like the sadhana of the hundred-armed [Yama].

original: khyad par ni 'di nyid kyi sa bon yi ge hri ste /
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di nyid kyi sa bon yi ge hri ste /
translated: The difference is that the seed syllable here is hrih.

original: gdod pa yang mi'i'o //
analyzed: gdod pa yang mi'i'o //
translated: The skull is also human.

translated: One should rub in that way, or else with one’s feet.

original: sngon du bsnyen pa dang bral bas dgos pa mi 'grub pa bstan pa'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa dang bral bas dgos pa mi 'grub pa bstan pa'i don gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the statement that one does not accomplish the purpose without the prior service is stated:

original: 'bum bzlas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bum bzlas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If one recites one hundred thousand times, and so forth.

original: rnal 'byor bdag nyid ni lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bdag nyid ni lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The yogin is one who is endowed with the yoga of the deity.

original: dngos grub ste zhes pa ni gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs thob pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub ste zhes pa ni gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs thob pa'o //
translated: The power is the attainment of the form of Yamantaka.

original: smos ci dgos zhes pa ni 'di yang mi rnams kyis ngag gi spyod yul ma yin te sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smos ci dgos zhes pa ni 'di yang mi rnams kyis ngag gi spyod yul ma yin te sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What need is there to say means that this is not even within the range of human speech, because it is made the domain of the Buddha.

original: gcig pa chen po btung bar bya //
analyzed: gcig pa chen po btung bar bya //
translated: One should drink the great unity.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: And so forth.

original: de gang gi tshe btung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de gang gi tshe btung bar bya zhe na /
translated: When should one drink?

original: re re las zhes pa ni nyi ma so so la'o //
analyzed: re re las zhes pa ni nyi ma so so la'o //
translated: One should drink from each, that is, from each day.

original: nyi ma so so la ma rnyed na ci ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: nyi ma so so la ma rnyed na ci ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If one does not find it on each day, what should one do?

original: zla ba re re la'o //
analyzed: zla ba re re la'o //
translated: One should drink from each month, that is, from each month.

original: zla ba re re la yang ma rnyed na /
analyzed: zla ba re re la yang ma rnyed na /
translated: If one does not find it even in each month,

original: gsungs pa / lo re re la ste gtor ma sbyin zhes bya ba la sogs par 'brel to //
analyzed: gsungs pa / lo re re la ste gtor ma sbyin zhes bya ba la sogs par 'brel to //
translated: it is said, one should drink from each year, and so forth, connecting it with one should offer the bali.

original: gtor ma zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mchod pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: gtor ma zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mchod pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The bali is an aspect of the offering to the Tathagatas.

original: nang gi bdag nyid can gyi sbyin sreg las so //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid can gyi sbyin sreg las so //
translated: From the inner fire sacrifice.

original: gang nas she na /
analyzed: gang nas she na /
translated: From where?

original: sna nas so //
analyzed: sna nas so //
translated: From the nose.

original: drug cu rtsa bzhi zhes pa ni 'di yang dbyu gu zhes pa 'dir 'brel to //
analyzed: drug cu rtsa bzhi zhes pa ni 'di yang dbyu gu zhes pa 'dir 'brel to //
translated: Sixty-four is connected here with “hours.”

original: don ni 'di yin te /🔽bzhis lhag pa'i dbyu gu drug cu ni sdom pa ste /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te / bzhis lhag pa'i dbyu gu drug cu ni sdom pa ste /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: dbyu gu drug cu ni nyin zhag gcig la'o //
analyzed: dbyu gu drug cu ni nyin zhag gcig la'o //
translated: Sixty-four hours is a day.

original: nyin zhag gcig bo de'i dbyu gu las cir 'gyur zhe na /🔽drug cu rtsa bzhir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig bo de'i dbyu gu las cir 'gyur zhe na / drug cu rtsa bzhir zhes pa ste /
translated: What is the result of a day’s hours?

original: drug cu rtsa bzhi la ni zhag gi lhag ma la zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: drug cu rtsa bzhi la ni zhag gi lhag ma la zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Sixty-four is the remainder of the day.

original: 'di'i man ngag kyang sna nas te dang por rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / mi bskyod pa dang / don yod grub pa dang / na ra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rnams kyi so so zhing yang ra ti lnga'i tshad la mi bskyod pa lhag ma la /
analyzed: 'di'i man ngag kyang sna nas te dang por rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / mi bskyod pa dang / don yod grub pa dang / na ra la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rnams kyi so so zhing yang ra ti lnga'i tshad la mi bskyod pa lhag ma la /
translated: The instruction here is also from the nose. First, the nature of Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, Akṣobhya, Amoghasiddhi, and Nārāyaṇa, etc., is the measure of five ratis. The remainder of Akṣobhya is

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i ni dngul chu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i ni dngul chu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The mercury of Vajrasattva

original: ra ti gcig btul te der bsre bar bya'o //
analyzed: ra ti gcig btul te der bsre bar bya'o //
translated: is to be mixed with one part of mercury.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan blang ba ni nag mo dang sngo bsangs ma la ni nag po'i phyogs la blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan blang ba ni nag mo dang sngo bsangs ma la ni nag po'i phyogs la blang bar bya'o //
translated: For taking Ratnasaṃbhava, one should take it on the dark side for a black or dark-blue woman,

original: dkar mo dang dkar sham la ni dkar po'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: dkar mo dang dkar sham la ni dkar po'i phyogs la'o //
translated: and on the bright side for a white or whitish woman.

original: gzhan yang gal te @287b nag po dang / dkar po'i phyogs zhes bya ba gang gis kyang mthun par grub pa de bzhin du de'i nang gses kyi dbye ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te @287b nag po dang / dkar po'i phyogs zhes bya ba gang gis kyang mthun par grub pa de bzhin du de'i nang gses kyi dbye ba ni /
translated: Moreover, if it is established by any means that there is a dark and bright side, then the internal divisions are as follows.

original: dkar po'i phyogs kyi tshes gcig dang gnyis dang gsum la ni dkar po'i phyogs kyi dgos pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs kyi tshes gcig dang gnyis dang gsum la ni dkar po'i phyogs kyi dgos pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: On the first, second, and third days of the bright fortnight, one should accomplish the purpose of the bright side.

original: bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa la ni nag po'i phyogs kyi dgos pa bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa la ni nag po'i phyogs kyi dgos pa bya'o //
translated: On the fourth, fifth, and sixth days, one should do the purpose of the dark side.

original: de bzhin du bdun pa la sogs pa nyi ma gsum la yang dkar po'i phyogs kyi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdun pa la sogs pa nyi ma gsum la yang dkar po'i phyogs kyi dgos pa'o //
translated: Similarly, on the three days beginning with the seventh, it is the purpose of the bright side.

original: bcu pa la sogs pa'i nyi ma gsum la yang nag po'i phyogs kyi dgos pa'o //🔽tshes bcu gsum la sogs pa'i nyi ma gsum la yang dkar po'i phyogs kyi dgos pa'o ;
analyzed: bcu pa la sogs pa'i nyi ma gsum la yang nag po'i phyogs kyi dgos pa'o // tshes bcu gsum la sogs pa'i nyi ma gsum la yang dkar po'i phyogs kyi dgos pa'o ;
translated: The three days beginning with the tenth are for the dark fortnight.🔽The three days beginning with the thirteenth are for the bright fortnight.

original: / ji skad gsungs pa las go rims bzlog pas nag po'i phyogs kyi tshes gcig la sogs pa nyi ma gsum la rtogs par bya'o //🔽lung las / ri bong can nyid nyi ma ste //
analyzed: / ji skad gsungs pa las go rims bzlog pas nag po'i phyogs kyi tshes gcig la sogs pa nyi ma gsum la rtogs par bya'o // lung las / ri bong can nyid nyi ma ste //
translated: The three days beginning with the first day of the dark fortnight should be understood in the reverse order from the above.🔽A scripture says,🔽The moon is the sun,

original: nyi ma ri bong can nyid do //🔽ri bong can zhes bya ba ni dkar po'i phyogs yin la /
analyzed: nyi ma ri bong can nyid do // ri bong can zhes bya ba ni dkar po'i phyogs yin la /
translated: The sun is the moon.🔽The moon is the bright fortnight,

original: nyi ma ni nag po'i phyogs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma ni nag po'i phyogs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The sun is the dark fortnight.

original: ji skad gsungs pa dkar po'i nyin mo dang / mtshan mo'i lhag ma la sna bug g-yon pa nas blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa dkar po'i nyin mo dang / mtshan mo'i lhag ma la sna bug g-yon pa nas blugs par bya'o //
translated: As stated, on the remaining days of the bright fortnight and the night, one should inhale through the left nostril.

original: mtshan mo'i lhag ma la yang sna bug g-yas pa'i bu gnas so //
analyzed: mtshan mo'i lhag ma la yang sna bug g-yas pa'i bu gnas so //
translated: On the remaining nights, one should inhale through the right nostril.

original: de yang sna ru chu dang / dbang chen sbyor bas sna bug g-yon par te shin tu bzang ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sna ru chu dang / dbang chen sbyor bas sna bug g-yon par te shin tu bzang ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, water and earth are joined in the nose, and in the left nostril, which is not very good.

original: me dang rlung sbyor bas ni 'bring bo'o //
analyzed: me dang rlung sbyor bas ni 'bring bo'o //
translated: By joining fire and wind, it is middling.

original: sna bug g-yas par yang me dang rlung dang sbyor ba ni thams cad blugs par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sna bug g-yas par yang me dang rlung dang sbyor ba ni thams cad blugs par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Also, by joining fire and wind in the right nostril, it is not to be poured into all.

original: rlung dang dbang chen sbyor ba de nyid tsam la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rlung dang dbang chen sbyor ba de nyid tsam la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Only that much is to be given by joining wind and earth.

original: de skad gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: sa dang chu la bzang po'i las //
analyzed: sa dang chu la bzang po'i las //
translated: Earth and water are good karma,

original: rlung dang me la nag po'o ;
analyzed: rlung dang me la nag po'o ;
translated: wind and fire are bad.

original: / zla ba bzang po yang dag rig /'od rno ba la 'bring po'o //
analyzed: / zla ba bzang po yang dag rig /'od rno ba la 'bring po'o //
translated: The moon is good, and the sun is middling, with sharp light.

original: gal te nyi ma'i rlung dang mer //
analyzed: gal te nyi ma'i rlung dang mer //
translated: If the sun is in wind and fire,

original: nges par yang ni 'chi ba ste //
analyzed: nges par yang ni 'chi ba ste //
translated: then death is certain.

original: de nyid zla ba byung gyur na //
analyzed: de nyid zla ba byung gyur na //
translated: If the moon arises in that place,

original: shin tu sdug bsngal ster ba min //
analyzed: shin tu sdug bsngal ster ba min //
translated: it does not give rise to great suffering.

original: zhes pa'o // sbyor ba rnam pa bzhi ni rlung dang dbang chen dang me dang chu dang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // sbyor ba rnam pa bzhi ni rlung dang dbang chen dang me dang chu dang zhes bya ste /
translated: The four kinds of conjunctions are wind, earth, fire, and water.

original: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du logs dang steng dang dbus dang 'og rnams nas rlung rab tu rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du logs dang steng dang dbus dang 'og rnams nas rlung rab tu rgyu ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristics of the wind moving from the left, above, middle, and below are respectively the characteristics of the good, bad, and neutral.

original: bya ba gzhan dag la yang sbyor ba 'di nyid las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid rnams su rang nyid shes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba gzhan dag la yang sbyor ba 'di nyid las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i mtshan nyid rnams su rang nyid shes par byas pa'o //
translated: One should understand the characteristics of the good and bad by oneself from this very application to other actions.

original: gang zhig rtag tu gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pa de'i @288a * //
analyzed: gang zhig rtag tu gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor dang ldan pa de'i @288a * //
translated: One who is always endowed with the yoga of Yamāri

original: gang byas pa ni gshin rje gshed rje de nyid kyi bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang byas pa ni gshin rje gshed rje de nyid kyi bya ba ste /
translated: has the action of Yamāri.

original: de thob pa la ni cung zad kyang brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de thob pa la ni cung zad kyang brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nothing is said about his attainment.

original: gang yang goms par bya ba ma yin pa de la ni 'di lta bus lhag par mos par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang yang goms par bya ba ma yin pa de la ni 'di lta bus lhag par mos par bya ba yin te /
translated: But that which is not to be cultivated is to be imagined in this way.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽Always a little of whatever is eaten,

original: rtag tu cung zad ci za dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu cung zad ci za dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: gzhan yang bza' zhes pa ni me tog dang thig le la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bza' zhes pa ni me tog dang thig le la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Moreover, to eat refers to flowers, drops, and so on.

original: phud dbul zhes pa ni thog ma nyid kyi bshos gtsang ngo //
analyzed: phud dbul zhes pa ni thog ma nyid kyi bshos gtsang ngo //
translated: The first offering is the first pure food.

original: bla ma mnyes pas thams cad 'grub pas de la dbul ba'i don gsungs pa /
analyzed: bla ma mnyes pas thams cad 'grub pas de la dbul ba'i don gsungs pa /
translated: Since everything is accomplished by pleasing the guru, the meaning of offering is stated:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
translated: Then, etc.

original: yon ni phul du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: yon ni phul du gyur pa yin no //
translated: The gift is excellent.

original: nye bar mkho bo'i khyad par kun //
analyzed: nye bar mkho bo'i khyad par kun //
translated: All the special necessities

original: zhes pa ni gang dag 'khor zhing btub pa rnams te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gang dag 'khor zhing btub pa rnams te /
translated: are those that are suitable to be offered.

original: de'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ro //
translated: That is their special quality.

original: de dag gsal bar byed pa ste de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gsal bar byed pa ste de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: They are clarified, and that is what is meant by that.

original: le'u bcu gnyis pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u bcu gnyis pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the twelfth chapter is complete.

original: // / bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag mtshan bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag mtshan bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach the characteristics of the Bhagavān, it is said:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, etc.

original: sdig pa'i las ni ji snyed pa //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las ni ji snyed pa //
translated: As much as there are sinful actions

original: zhes pa la sdig pa'i las ni sdug bsngal pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sdig pa'i las ni sdug bsngal pa'o //
translated: . Sinful actions are painful.

original: shubs can ni ral gri'o //
analyzed: shubs can ni ral gri'o //
translated: The sheath is the sword.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste nye bar mtshon pa las so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste nye bar mtshon pa las so //
translated: The afflictions are desire and so on, from the point of view of the metaphor.

original: ji skad gsungs pa gzhan dag las yang rnam par dag pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa gzhan dag las yang rnam par dag pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the rest from other statements.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi dbus gnas bsam //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi dbus gnas bsam //
translated: One should imagine it in the middle of the realm of space.

original: zhes pa ni bdun po rnam par dag pa dang / bla na med pa'i mchod pa dang / tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgoms pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bdun po rnam par dag pa dang / bla na med pa'i mchod pa dang / tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgoms pa'i rjes la /
translated: After the purification of the seven, the unsurpassable worship, and the cultivation of the four brahmavihāras,

original: 'gro ba pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin la stong pa nyid du bsgoms pas rmi lam lta bur byas la /
analyzed: 'gro ba pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin la stong pa nyid du bsgoms pas rmi lam lta bur byas la /
translated: one should imagine the world as empty by the meditation on the emptiness of the nature of the grasped and grasper, and make it like a dream.

original: thogs par bya ba dang bral ba bdag nyid 'byung ba chen po nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: thogs par bya ba dang bral ba bdag nyid 'byung ba chen po nam mkha' ste /
translated: The self, free from obstruction, is the great element of space.

original: nam mkha'i phyogs su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i phyogs su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate in the direction of space.

original: der ci zhe na /
analyzed: der ci zhe na /
translated: What there?

original: gsungs pa / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: gsungs pa / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The maṇḍala of the sun.

original: re pha las byung ba'o zhes lhag ma'o //
analyzed: re pha las byung ba'o zhes lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is clear.

original: rtse lnga pa zhes pa ni h'um yig las sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rtse lnga pa zhes pa ni h'um yig las sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
translated: The five-pointed vajra is the vajra cross arisen from the syllable hūṃ.

original: gnas der zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gnas der zhes pa ni /
translated: In that place means

original: gzhi gzhal yas khang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi gzhal yas khang zhes pa'o //
translated: in the foundation, the celestial mansion.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: rdo rje ra ba dang / rdo rje gur gyi nang du gnas pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i mu khyud la gnas pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi yongs su gyur pa las gzhan yas khang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje ra ba dang / rdo rje gur gyi nang du gnas pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i mu khyud la gnas pa'i 'byung ba chen po bzhi yongs su gyur pa las gzhan yas khang ngo //
translated: The great elements of the surrounding rim of the vajra cross within the vajra fence and the vajra tent transform into the celestial mansion.

original: @288b de bzhin du phyis kyi dag ba la yang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i nang du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: @288b de bzhin du phyis kyi dag ba la yang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i nang du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the later purities within the mandala circle.

original: dhi zhes pa ni sa bon nye bar bkod pa ste /
analyzed: dhi zhes pa ni sa bon nye bar bkod pa ste /
translated: The syllable dhi is the seed syllable arrangement.

original: 'dir yang sngar bzhin du mngon par byang chub ba rnam pa lnga la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang sngar bzhin du mngon par byang chub ba rnam pa lnga la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, as before, there are the five manifest enlightenments, and so on.

original: khyad par ni nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / rdo rje dang / sa bon gyur pa las zhu ba dang / zhu ba las bzhengs pa dang / yang rdo rjer gnas pa dang / sa bon nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / rdo rje dang / sa bon gyur pa las zhu ba dang / zhu ba las bzhengs pa dang / yang rdo rjer gnas pa dang / sa bon nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The difference is that from the transformation of the sun, moon, vajra, and seed syllable, there is melting, arising from the melting, abiding in the vajra, and the seed syllable itself is Vajrasattva.

original: de dag yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das ma de nyid skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das ma de nyid skyes pa'o //
translated: From their complete transformation, the Bhagavatī herself is born as a man.

original: de'i thugs kar sa bon las dkyil 'khor pa'i lha rnams spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i thugs kar sa bon las dkyil 'khor pa'i lha rnams spro bar bya'o //
translated: At his heart, the deities of the mandala are emanated from the seed syllable.

original: phyag ces pa ni g-yas pa'i phyag gi gtso bo'o //
analyzed: phyag ces pa ni g-yas pa'i phyag gi gtso bo'o //
translated: The “right” hand is the principal one.

original: gzhan dag ces pa ni lnga po rnams su'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces pa ni lnga po rnams su'o //
translated: “The others” are the five.

original: ral gri dang / gri gug dang / 'khor lo dang / padma dang / tho ba rnams so //
analyzed: ral gri dang / gri gug dang / 'khor lo dang / padma dang / tho ba rnams so //
translated: The sword, the flaying knife, the discus, the lotus, and the hammer.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa 'di rnams ni zhe sdang gshin rje gshed la sogs pa bzhin du zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa rnams so //🔽l'a sye ni dkar zhing sngo ba sgeg pa'i cha byad do //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa 'di rnams ni zhe sdang gshin rje gshed la sogs pa bzhin du zhal gsum pa phyag drug pa rnams so // l'a sye ni dkar zhing sngo ba sgeg pa'i cha byad do //
translated: These Vajraḍākinīs and so forth have three faces and six arms, like Aṅkurika and so forth.🔽Lāsyā is white and blue, with the costume of a dancer.

original: phreng ba ma ser mo zhes bya ba ni phreng ba bsnams pa'o //🔽gar ma dmar mo gar sgyur ba'o //
